loans.name: Gakurya

texts.en:
Gakurya is a single man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, he has operated a food stall business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Gakurya dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 he wants to purchase food stock of beans, rice, and cooking fats and furniture for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase food stock of beans, rice, and cooking fats and furniture for his business.

loans.name: María Flora

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socio del Banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su Iglesia se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Parroquial y posee más de doscientos años de antigüedad, la Laguna de Tari, se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a unos 5 kilómetros del Centro Parroquial. Su gente es amable, responsable, y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 25 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 7, 6 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es aserrador, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María labora en una guardería, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que va a comprar un bosque para el negocio de su esposo, con el crédito anterior no tuvo ningún problema con los pagos y ya realizo la cancelación total del mismo. Está muy contenta ya que con el crédito a podido aportar a la economía de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.

Le gusta el  banco comunal  por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y el compañerismo que hay entre sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Unión y Prosperidad" communal bank, and lives in Zhidmad parish in Cuenca. This is a place where one can admire the beauty of nature. Its church is located in the parish center, and is more than 200 years old. The Laguna de Teri is located approximately five kilometers from the parish center. The people here are friendly, responsible, and maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples. 

María is 25, married, and has four children, ages 9, 7, 6, and 3. Her three eldest children go to a small local school. Her husband has a lumber business, and they own the house where they live.  

Maria works in a daycare, Monday to Friday, from 8:00 in the morning, until 4:00 in the afternoon. She is taking out another loan to buy a woodlot for her husband's business. She had no problem with the payments on the previous loan, and has already paid it back in full. 

She is very happy, because with the loan she has been able to contribute to the household finances, and support her family. She likes the communal bank because it is easy to get loans, and for the comradeship that exists among the members.

loans.use: to buy a woodlot.

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en: Srun is a mother of six children and a villager from Battambang province.  She encounters her family‘s hardship via rice farming and her paid-working job. This is the first loan for Srun with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee. She hopes this loan can make more income for her family.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Marivic dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
My name is Simona M.. I am owner of a small local grocery store for seven years. This is located in front of the soccer fields in this community, which strategic for my sales. With the gains that I obtain from my business , it helps to pay for schooling for my three children. My children also help with the running the business in their free time after school and on weekends. 

Descripción del Negocio: Me llamo Simona M., soy dueña de una pulpería desde hace siete años, esta ubicado frente a las canchas de foot ball en esta comunidad, lo que estratégico para mis ventas, ya que a partir del jueves mis ventas aumentan.. Con las ganancias que obtengo de mi negocio ayudo a mis tres hijos en sus estudios, ellos también colaboran en el negocio en sus ratos libres y fines de semana.

loans.use: Purchase of bottled soft drinks, various refreshments, chicken, juice, milk, hygienic paper, basic sugar, grains.

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.en:
The business of electronic equipment is something Mr. Yawovi A. has engaged in for 5 years. Born in 1965 in Aného, he is married and the father of three (03) children. Thanks to this business, he is able to meet the needs of his children. His work consists of going to the port and acquiring at very low prices irons, televisions, hi-fi systems, and other equipment to re-sell at Kpémé. Many people come to get their electronic equipment with him. With this growing business, Mr. A. is asking for a loan of $800 to increase his sales and enlarge his equipment stock. This will improve his living conditions and those of his entire family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Le commerce des appareils électroniques est une activité qu’exerce Monsieur A. Yawovi depuis 5 ans. Né en 1965 à Aného, il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. C’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il subvient aux besoins de ses enfants. Son commerce consiste à se rendre au port et à acquérir à vil prix des fers à repasser, des télévisions, des chaînes Hi Fi, et autres instruments pour les revendre à Kpémé. Beaucoup de personnes viennent acquérir leurs appareils électroniques auprès de lui. Avec cette activité grandissante, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires en agrandissant son stock d’appareils. Cela améliorera ses conditions de vie et celle de toute sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell electronic equipment

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has four children. Her husband is a factory employee whose salary wasn't enough to support their family, so she decided to start her business six years ago. She works in the place formerly used by her mother and sells Mexican delicatessen. Her hard work has helped her retain the approval of her customers for so long.

Veronica now needs a loan of $475 to purchase wholesale the products she needs to make her food. This will give her a bigger profit and allow her business to grow. She will pay back the loan in 4 to 8 months. You can help make this family's life better, don't think twice and decide to help Veronica.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Verónica es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, sin embargo el salario que recibe no cubría las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Vero decidió iniciar su negocio, ya tenia el local que anteriormente era trabajado por su madre, y desde hace seis años Verónica se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos. El buen sazón y esfuerzo que ella le da a su negocio le ha ayudado a permanecer por tanto tiempo en el gusto de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Vero necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos de mayoreo para obtener mayores beneficios y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Verónica.

loans.use: Purchase products/ ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Keang

texts.en: Mrs. Keang M. is 24 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband, 35, and their 3 children.  Kean M. and her husband sell charcoal around their village and earn about $7/day combined.  She will use this loan to buy a motorbike so that they can begin selling their charcoal to other nearby villages.  In the future, she would like to start raising animals so that she can increase her income and send her children to higher education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport their charcoal

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba A. has been selling perfume for the past 9 years. She is 45 years old, has finished high school, is married, and has 4 sons. Her husband is in the retail business, the oldest son is working in Russia, and her younger sons help out with the business.

In 2003, Matluba began working with MicroInvest. Before receiving the first loan, she worked in a place that was one square meter. With the loan, she was able to expand both her business location and her assortment of perfumes. Since then, her profits doubled. With the next loan she plans to increase the assortment of her goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Абдуллоева Матлюба занимается реализацией парфюмерий вот уже 9лет. Матлюбе 45 лет образование среднее специальное, замужем, имеет четверых сыновей. Муж занимается торговлей, старший сын на заработках в РФ, младшие сыновья помогают родителям в торговле.

В 2003году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест». До получения кредита место её деятельности составлял один метр. После получения займа она расширила место деятельности, увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза больше. На будущее планирует увеличить ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: Increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Salma Betuel

texts.pt:
Salma is unmarried, but lives with the father of her 2 children. She started in the loan program in 2006. She sells new clothes in the Manjacaze market. Her husband is a miner and works out of the country. Salma is the one who takes care of the house and 2 children the majority of the time. With her profits, she pays for the schooling of her children and the household expenses. This way, the children don't suffer the absence of their father. If her business succeeds, she hopes to help her husband pay for the construction of a house.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Salma e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006.Ela vende roupa nova no Mercado de Manjacaze. o marido de Salma e mineiro e trabalha fora do Pais.Salma e quem cuida da casa e dos filhos a maior parte do tempo.Com os lucros ela paga a escola dos filhos e paga pelas despesas da casa.portanto os filhos nao passam mal devido a ausencia do Pai.Se tudo correr bem ela vai ajudar o marido nas despesas da construcao da residencia.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanu T. is a 54 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her son works in a private office and her younger son helps her with her work.

Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Krishna Bahadur T., opened their grocery shop four years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, pulse, noodles, biscuits, etc. She meets her family's expenses from her shop’s income.

So Mrs. Maharjan is requesting her first loan of Rs10000 to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia is a member of the communal bank Teresa de Calcuta. She sells vegetables at least 3 days a week- on Monday, Thursday and Saturday. Her business is located in the Huaraz market in the Ancash department of Peru.

With this loan of 300 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of carrots, 1 sack of betarraga, a Peruvian vegetable, 2 sacks of cabbage, one packet of celery, one packet of pore, and other vegetables.

Teodosia is 36 years old, married, and has 2 young children. Her husband sells meat in the market, and both of them help to support their children and meet the needs of their household.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodosia pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa de Calcuta, se dedica a la venta de verduras al por menor, los días lunes, jueves y sábado. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de zanahoria, 1 saco de betarraga, 2 sacos de col, un paquete de apio, un paquete de poro y otras verduras.

La señora Teodosia tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vende carne al por menor, ambos se apoyan para alimentar a sus hijos y satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in 1972, Kokou A. is married and the father of five. An excellent tailor in his neighborhood, he receives customer orders from just about everywhere. He continuously adds apprentices to his shop. Faced with this situation, his only sewing machine prevents him from serving his customers on a timely basis and from doing a good job training his apprentices. To resolve this problem, he had the idea to buy sewing machines, but this requires financing. Finding himself at a disadvantage, he is here to request a loan of $600, which will enable him to realize his dream of making more from his line of work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né à Djita en 1972, Monsieur A. Kokou est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Excellent couturier de sa localité, il reçoit des commandes d’un peu partout. Le nombre de ses apprentis ne cesse d’augmenter. Face à cette situation, sa seule machine ne lui permet pas de servir les clients à temps et de bien former ses apprentis. Pour résoudre ce problème, il a eu l’idée de s’acheter des machines mais cette réalisation nécessite des moyens financiers. Ce trouvant dans cette incapacité, il vient solliciter un financement de $600. Ceci lui permettra de réaliser son rêve en vue de mieux profiter de son métier.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.en:
Pelagio and his wife run a small bakery, a business he inherited from his father. He has two children to support, both of whom are in college. Although his bakery is doing well, he needs a loan to increase his production and to enable him to set the prices of his goods at more competitive rates.

With the requested loan, he will buy more products in bulk to drive down the prices of his products. In this way, the loan would make his breads and baked goods less expensive and, accordingly, the demand for his goods should increase. It is important for Pelagio to secure this loan because it will help to insure that he can make the payments that are necessary for his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Santa Benita

texts.en:
Santa Benita, a thirty-year-old woman and mother of five children, lives in the Río Arriba community of Baní. To supplement her family’s income, she sells a collection of shirts, pants, and underwear to women of her community. Santa Benita explains that her family is very needy, so she has to work hard to make money and help her husband support the children’s education.

With her loan, Santa Benita will buy more clothing. She says she’ll get the products from a new supplier who is offering the goods at very low prices. Santa Benita hopes that her business’ growth will help her improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire more pants, shirts, and underwear for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Eva's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and is a married woman with 1 child aged 16 years old. Eva owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 12am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (soda and beer) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Wande, who has business dealing in cafe.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items (soda and beer) for her business.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S. is 38 years old. She sells a variety of vegetables in Kampong Cham province, earning a sizable daily revenue of  $20 (US) per day in total sales. Her husband works for the electric company, managing power grids. He earns a decent salary as well. They have three children who are still working their way through school. They are proud to have been able to give their children access to education. They feel comfortable taking out a loan at this time in their lives to start a new business that their children can help run during their time home from school. They will rent a large plot of farmland on which they will grow yams. The rest of the loan will be used to buy yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To rent farmland and buy inputs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
"For more than 30 years I have been in the business of making and selling tamales along the streets of Nuevo Laredo. This business is the source of income for my family, as I am a single mother and have 3 children who need attention and need me to spend more time with them. For this reason I am asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars, to build a fixed stand at my home, and in this way I can take care of my business and my children."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 30 años que me dedico a la elaboración y venta de tamales por las calles de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijo los cuales necesitan atención y que esta mas tiempos con ellos. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un puesto fijo en la casa y así estar atendiendo mi negocio y cuidando a mis hijos.

loans.use: Build a stand for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Vida Group

texts.en:
Members of Ms. Lourdes D. M.’s group describe her as being the “head “of the group. Energetic and ambitious, she is borrowing from Esperanza for the first time. Her group consists of young and ambitious ladies who hope to change their lives through these loans. The newly formed group is called Mujeres D’ Vida and has five members. In the picture provided, Ms. D. M. is second from the right. The sixth person (standing in the back) is their loan officer, Nelly Mercedes Pena.

Ms. D. M. is starting a food shop that specializes in selling various cheeses as well as salami and sausage. Her loan will be used to purchase the items. The business will be run out of her house. One day, she hopes to have store.

She is the mother of two children, ages five and eight. She enjoys listening to music and going to the beach. Even as she plans on starting her business, she is trying to learn English. Lourde's story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza's micro-credit loans . This group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. Each associate in this bank has a similar business, whether it is selling cheese and meats or operating a hair salon. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Tékponou I, Madame G. Akouvi est une commerçante très vaillante qui vit actuellement à Logodomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. 

Vu la rentabilité de son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant des noix de palme en gros dans les grandes zones de production.

Le revenu réalisé lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille car son mari n’est qu’un simple cultivateur qui a toujours un maigre rendement.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Tékponou I, Mrs. Akouvi G. is a hard-working merchant who presently lives in Logodomé in the Vo Prefecture. She is married and the mother of three children.

Since her business is very profitable, she is asking for a loan to increase her turnover by purchasing palm nuts wholesale in the areas where they are produced in quantity.

The increased income she will earn will allow her to ensure the education of her children and improve living conditions for her family, since her husband is a simple farmer whose earnings are always meager.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of palm nuts to transform into oil

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Pov S. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She now lives in Trapaing Chrai Village in Takeo Province, and she is a pig breeder. 

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Pov S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy eight more piglets for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food. 

Her husband, Mr. Nop Nhen, is a construction worker who does not make enough income to support his family. 

Mrs. Pov S. is 47 years old and the mother of two children, one is a laborer in a rubber field while the other is attending school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Cidia

texts.es:
La señora  Cidia, socia del Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en la Región San Martín,  provincia y distrito D. Bellavista, Centro Poblado Menor D. la Libertad. Se dedica a la venta D. comida y chicha D. maíz, que es una bebida regional muy agradable y solicitada, venD. en las afueras D. su casa.  Se inicia en el negocio porque tenía la necesidad D. generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos D. sus hijos, sobretodo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  productos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, condimentos, harina D. maíz y otros ingredientes para la preparación tanto D. sus platos como D. la chicha y D. esa manera poder satisfacer las exigencias D. sus clientes que en su mayoría son los trabajadores D. las obras que está ejecutando la Municipalidad D. su caserío. 

La señora Cidia tiene 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 03 D. sus 09 hijos que tiene. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas D. sacar adelante a sus hijos, quien desea, más adelante, complementar su negocio con la venta D. ropa usada.
texts.en:
Cidia, a member of the La Libertad Communal Bank, lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Bellavista, in the lesser town center of La Libertad. She sells food and chica D. maíz, a very popular and pleasant local drink, outsiD. of her house. She started this business because she needed to generate some income to settle her children's school expenses. With this loan of $325, which she will repay in six months, she will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, condiments, corn flour, and other ingredients to prepare dishes like chicha and satisfy her customers, the majority of whom are municipal workers in her town. Cidia is 46 years old, lives with her husband and three of her nine children. She is a very persistent and responsible woman eager to move her children forward, who later hopes to complement her business by selling used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, condiments, corn flour, etc.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan lives in Khachmaz. She was born in 1986. She is married but does not have any children. 

Reyhan's husband has been in the taxi business for one year. 

Now they are requesting a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts to the taxi. 

Reyhan's husband is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing F. sells fufu. Fufu is gotten from fermented cassava. She purchases cassava from farmers to process into fufu. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more cassava to process into fufu to sell. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to process into fufu

loans.name: Catana

texts.en:
Catana T. is 56 years old with a plesent personality and good health. She is the leader of a loan group with Microinvest in Carabetovca village. She lives in Carabetovca village, Basarabeasca district, Moldova. Her main business is agriculture. Catana's family owns  5.2 hectaire of arable land which they have worked since 2000. The farm is highly mechanized but Catana still has to do a lot of manual work.  She also works as part of the local staff of Microinvest in the Carabetovca village loan group. 

Her farm is located in Carabetovca village Basarabeasca district and the business was launched in 2000. This is the third loan from Microinvest: the first, in the amount of 5000 lei, was repaid on 24,05,20007, and was used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and service payments , the second, in the amount 5000 lei, was repaid on 24,12,2007, and was used to purchase seeds and to pay equipment servicing. 

The requested  loan is required to purchase fertilizers, seeds and engineering services payments.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds and to pay for engineering services.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia se fue a radicar a la Republica de Argentina para poder buscar mejor nivel de vida como costurera de prendas de vestir, pero lamentablemente le fue mal y sufrió muchas injusticias; es por esa razón que retornó a Bolivia para poder emprender su propio taller de costura juntamente con su esposo. Tiene un hijo de dos años de edad y  viven en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una maquina Overlock que le ayudará mucho para poder trabajar en su taller de costuras.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado por Lidia.
texts.en:
Lidia left to settle in the Republic of Argentina to be able to find a better way of life as a clothing seamstress but unfortunately the move went badly and she suffered many injustices. For this reason, she returned to Bolivia to be able to launch her own sewing workshop together with her husband. They have a 2 year old son and live in their parents' house located in the Pasankeri zone of the city La Paz. The loan money will be used to purchase an Overlock sewing machine that will help her a lot in her sewing workshop. This is her first loan with IMPRO; the completed evaluation qualifies Lidia for the approval of her requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor Y. is 27 years old. He is married and the father of 3 children. Bakhtiyor is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. He also raises cattle.

Bakhtiyor has been working the land for two years. He learned this skill from his beloved father (pictured) who takes care of his land when Bakhtiyor travels to the market to sell his produce and cattle. His loving wife is also involved in the family business, as you can see in the photo.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and timetaking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix his house and save money to support his family. He is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni. Bakhtiyor thanks your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Raquel Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Raquel tiene una óptica Daylop  que inicio hace varios años con ayuda de su esposo, luego que salio de su carrera universitaria, surgió la idea de poner su propio negocio, lo cual no fue fácil al inicio ya que el mercado esta saturado. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela, tiene dos hijos que estudian, su esposo es maestro de obra. Con esta solicitud quiere invertir en la compra de equipos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de su trabajo y estar a la altura de la tecnología. Sus objetivo es poder crecer a nivel nacional y ser reconocida, sus planes a futuro es poder dar los estudio a sus hijos, mejorar su nivel económico.
texts.en:
Doña Raquel has an eyeglass store that is named Daylop that she started several years ago with help of her husband after she finished her degree at the university. She had the idea to start her own business and it was not an easy start since there was a lot of competition. Doña Raquel is 34 years old and she lives in villa Venezuela. She has two children that are in school. Her husband is a craftsman. With this request for a loan she was wants to invest in buying equipment for her business that allow her to improve the quality for her work and to have the latest technology. Her objective is to expand her business to the national level and it to be well-known. Her plan for the future is to be able to give her children a good education and to improve her own economic level.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more modern equipment to better serve her customers

loans.name: Sharafbonu

texts.ru: Гафурова Шарафбону 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Она разводит скот во дворе. Дети пасут малый рогатый скот на пастбище, а крупно рогатый скот содержат дома. Муж сажает  арахис в 4 гектара земли, а также лук. Как только поспеет урожай, собирают и продают на рынке. До продажи  скота можно продавать арахис и лук. А потом  когда закончиться посев и урожай, можно и продать скот и жить на этом. Благодаря поддержки Микроинвест развивают свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharafbonu G. was born in 1958, she is married and has 2 children. Sharafbonu has a college education. She raises livestock in her yard. The children take the smaller livestock out to pasture and feed the large livestock at home. Sharafbonu’s husband plants peanuts on 4 hectares of land, he also plants onions. Afterwards when planting and harvesting are over, they can sell their livestock and live on the proceeds. Thanks to the support of MicroInvest they are growing their business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Ally

texts.en:
Charcoal is the main source of fuel in most of the developing countries due to high cost and unstable supply of electricity.

Ally M. is a micro-businessman who runs a charcoal business at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the charcoal wholesale direct from the producers and sells to retail customers at Buguruni.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more charcoal so as to meet his business demand.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 55 años, es una madre muy admirada, aunque sus hijos ya no viven bajo su mismo techo, todavía vela por ellos, vive en su propia casa y anhela que sus hijos tengan la mejor D. las vidas. Martina tiene un puesto D. venta D. golosinas, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que se encuentra en uno D. los parques más importantes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, ella es una vendedora muy convincente y siempre persuaD. a las personas D. que se lleven algo para ir saboreando en el camino. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, pero lo que menos le gusta es permanecer todo el día en su puesto bajo el inclemente sol y sin poder ir a ningún lado. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda para poder trabajar con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el primer préstamo D. Martina con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las socias D. su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por las responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 1000 soles que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad D. productos que tiene en su puesto, para así tener más mercadería que vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martina who is 55 years old is a much admired mother. Although her children do not live under the same roof, she watches over them. She lives in her own house and wants her children to have the best of lives. Martina has a stand selling sweets which is very popular as it is located in one of the most important parks in the city of Juliaca. She is a very convincing saleswoman and always persuades people to take something to eat on their way. She has had this business for 8 years and what she most likes it to talk with her neighboring saleswomen but what she likes least it to remain at her stand all day in the inclement sun and without being able to go anywhere. In the future she hopes to have a store to be able to work with greater ease. This is Martina’s first loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time to not harm the members of the communal bank where she is much loved for the responsibility that she demonstrates. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting she plans to increase the amount of products that she has at her stand to be able to have more merchandise to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina has been raising a clothes business in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 16 years. She belongs to Maendeleo  group loan (Group code 2023).  Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Edina is 45 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 16  and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: MAGUETTE N. dite nogaye est une femme mariée très brave qui fait des activités génératrices  de revenu afin d'aider son mari dans les dépenses courantes;son activité consiste à confectionner des chaussures et des pagnes en vue de les revendre sur le marché local et en mauritanie:elle veut bénéficier de ce pret pour augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Maguette N., nicknamed Nogaye, is a very respectable married woman who engages in petty trading in order to help her husband support the family. Her business is making shoes and "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) in view of selling them on the local market and in Mauritania. She wants to take out this loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of shoes and "pagnes"

loans.name: Soo

texts.en: Soo T. Lematua, 36, is married with 10 children.  She has many years of experience in the handicrafts business.  She sells to villagers one day per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD.  Soo expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala.  SPBD loans are Soo’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase machine,drill.vanish,and other tools using for crafts.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children. Currently they are all working and are living independently.

Amalia sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly for breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we call Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With her large customer base, Amalia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living I. Boeng village I. Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Chantha C. is the 38-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. She also breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband, Mr. Pav Mun, is employed I. a government department. Mrs. Chantha C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and chickens, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She has three children who attend the local school. 

All of the members of this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva. 

The other four people I. the photograph, Mrs. Sok Ny, Mrs. Chan Sopheap, Mrs. Mean Morn and Mr. Yonn Vanna, are the group guarantee and they also presented I. the picture with their group loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chickens, and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita Ranjitkar, a resident of Tangal, lives in a single family household with her husband and two sons. Her older son works in a finance office and her younger son is studying in grade 12.

Together, Mrs. Ranjitkar and her husband, Mr. Sankhaman Ranjitkar, opened their small restaurant seven years ago to strengthen the economic condition of their family. They sell different varieties of food items in their shop. Specifically, she prepares Newari foods. The majority of the people living in the Lalitpur district are Newars, so Newari food is very famous and tasty. The demand for Newari food is increasing day by day. They also serve tea and coffee. Her restaurant is small but very popular in her locality.

Now, Mrs. Ranjitkar is requesting her second loan of Rs 20,000.00 from Kiva to buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her shop

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda Isabel Hernández Ávila tiene la edad de 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. La actividad económica es un cafetín. Doña Yolanda es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 6 años que  se dedica a este negocio. Doña Yolanda dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, café, jugos, refrescos naturales, pan y galletas. El deseo de ella es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean  buenos profesionales.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio E. is from the village of Brgy. 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 55 years-old and unmarried. Claudio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Claudio has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Claudio joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claudio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Zone Vay Group

texts.en:
Zone Vay Group is a group of five borrowers led by Bill T. who is 27 years old and a 12th grade student. He is single and does not have a child. He lives in Molton Corner, a community that is situated north of the outskirts of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Bill's business is selling palm oil. He buys palm oil wholesale from farmers and sells retail to residents of Molton Corner. He has been running this business for three years and hopes to become an importer of different kinds of goods in the future.

Bill sometimes faces rainy season problems because it slows down oil production. He talks to his customers with a good manner and provides a good product to customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.

Bill needs this loan in order to purchase more palm oil to improve his business. He dreams of buying land and starting to build a house for his family to come.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil

loans.name: Havtgai

texts.en: H. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. Her son, who is 15, attends a local high school and her daughter, who is 3, stays at home. H.’s husband works for a construction company during the summer and fall and is a fuel stoker in the winter and spring. H. operates a grocery business in a rented shop in her town. She began her business in 1993 with the help of her husband and has become very established in the many years since. She began to plant her own vegetables in 2007 in order to supplement her business earnings and has become successful in that endeavor as well. She would like to expand her business even further in the future and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (700 USD) loan in order to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Lhane

texts.en: Lhane D. R. manages a welding shop in Norala, South Cotabato.  She started her shop in 1984.  Her business supports her family.  She has nine children; her eldest child is 27 years old.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to help finance her business with a low interest rate.  She’s requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy materials for her shop.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 53 year old widow with two children aged 27 and 31 years. Neither of her children go to school. She resides in a four room house she owns, where she is staying with six people. Aisha takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from buying food because she works at the very market where she buys the food.

Aisha works seven days a week in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people in retail and wholesale. She has a restaurant in Owino Market and sells all types of food plus tea. Her major business challenge is ever increasing prices of food due to famine in many villages of Uganda. She has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her fifteenth loan. Aisha joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. She aspires to own a fully refurbished hotel.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Esther Wakiuru

texts.en:
Esther is 32 years old and married with one daughter. She runs a clothing business. Before venturing into business she used to work as a casual laborer at Delmonte firm.

Esther sells bedcovers, mattresses, curtains, blankets, jackets, and pillow cases.She has been in this business for two years now. Her clients are the local residents. Her business challenges include price fluctuations of goods when buying them. She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to restock her business. Her goal in life is to become a wholesaler. She describes herself as a hardworking, faithful and dedicated woman, and she dreams of stablizing her family and having the best in life.

loans.use: To buy more bedcovers, bedsheets, mattress covers, curtains and sweaters

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia C. esta casada con el Sr. Eustaqio Giménez hace mas de quince años, ambos viven en el barrio Caacupemi de la ciudad de Aregua. En su domicilio tiene una despensa denominada “La loma” desde hace mas de diez años. 
En su despensa ofrecen productos de todo tipo para la canasta familiar y actualmente por la época de las fiesta precisan de productos bien variados y de buena calidad por lo que el crédito fue muy oportuno para la actividad.
 Gracias a los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo aumentar su inventario y lograr asi un mayor ingreso familiar a través de la comercialización de sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia C. has been married to Sr. Eustaqio Giménez for more than fifteen years. Both live in the neighborhood of Caacupemi in the city of Aregua. Amalia has been operating a food store out her home called “La Loma” for more than ten years.

At her store, she offers all types of products for the family dinner table. For the holiday party season, she wants to be stocked with a variety of high-quality products, so she will use her loan for this purpose.

Thanks to the loans from Fundación Paraguaya, she has been able to increase her inventory and generate more income for her family by selling these products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Siatuvai

texts.en:
Siatuvai E. is 35 and married with 1 child (8 years-old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  Siatuvai has 5 years of experience in this business.  Siatuvai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 190 tala or US $79 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Siatuvai joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Siatuvai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Siatuvai E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.22 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: T. Shuhrat is a 29-year-old married man. With great sacrifice he works in farming, tending his crops, and at the same time processes dried apricots to sell. It is important to emphasize that he is the father of two children and is obligated to take care of them and provide all that they need. Now, Shuhrat is looking for the support of IMON International to obtain a loan which he will use to buy more dried apricots for processing and later selling. His dream is to improve his economic activity and for this he looks to the support of Kiva, trusting that he will receive the needed support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Aticlan Group

texts.es: El grupo aticlan, se han unido  hace 5 años atras para poder salir avante y mantener a sus hijos y mantener a ellas misma,Ellas se han dedicado a la fabricacion de delantales para damas, y ellas salen a vender en distinta partes de Solola y Totonicapàn, pero viendo la necesidad de ampliar y obtener mas ganancias Acuden a la ASOCIACION ASDIR  para este apoyo. y para tener una mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The group Aticlan was formed 5 years ago, so that its members could get ahead and support their children and themselves. They work making women's aprons, which they sell in different parts of Solola and Totonicapàn. Seeing the need to expand their business and increase their earnings, and in order to have a better standard of living, they came to the Asociacion ASDIR for support.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for business making and selling aprons

loans.name: Arce

texts.en:
Arce Q. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Arce is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arce owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Arce is just starting this business. Arce's previous business was managing video games in her place.

In 2009, Arce joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arce is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arce from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia L. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Letecia is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia works in a family member's business in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Issan

texts.en:
Issan Shawki Ibrahim B. is 43 years old and is married. His family lives in Gaza and includes nine members with five school students.

Issan has a beverages store and aims to enlarge his business through increasing his purchases. This will increase his sales and increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for his store

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Ana Lilia D. L. C. T. tiene 28 años D. edad.  En L. foto elL. muestra uno D. los chalecos que elL. comercializa, y un voluntario nos modeL. otro D. ellos.

ElL. vive en L. comunidad D. Cerro del Marquéz, Valle D. Chalco Solidaridad Estado D. México. Es una acreditada activa D. L. UD. Estrellita.         


L. Señora Ana Lilia  se dedica a L. venta D. batas, overoles y chalecos reflejantes desD. hace 4 años. Por necesidad, comenzó a vender estas prendas  ya que sus hijos ingresaron  a L. escueL. y lo que su esposo ganaba  no alcanzaba para sus gastos, así  que al ver su situación económica,  deciD. buscar un lugar para obtener un préstamo.  
 A través D. una amiguita es como conoce a Fundación Realidad, y  L.  invita a integrarse a un grupo. Esta idea a elL. L. motiva porque le presenta L. oportunidad D. obtener un préstamo para invertir en más mercancía e incrementar sus ganancias  y D. esa manera, poder tener mejor solvencia económica. 

Su prioridad en este momento  es L. educación D. 4 D. sus hijos mismos que se encuentran estudiando, y uno más pequeño D. 1 año D. edad. 

Ana Lilia desea mejorar su calidad D. vida con este negocio y  agradece D. antemano L. ayuda que pueda recibir  

Los miembros del grupo son:

Ma Trinidad Jaimes Benítez                                  Venta D. cazos, parrillas
Virginia Mejia Gutiérrez                                        Impermeabilización
FabioL. Benítez Jaimes                                          Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Maria D. Lourdes García VelarD.                          Papelería
Maria José Maceda Patiño                                     Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Edith Rivera Romero                                             Venta D. ropa y zapato
Irma Godinez Tovar                                               Venta D. botanas
Gloria Hernández Carrillo                                     Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Guly Gema Méndez Zurita                                    Venta D. catalogo (cosméticos)
Maximina Patiño Santiago                                    Abarrotes
Carolina García VelarD.                                        Venta D. catalogo  (zapatos)
texts.en:
Ana Lilia is 28 years old. We can see her in the photograph, holding up one of the vests that she sells, while a volunteer models another. She lives in Cerro del Marquéz, Valle D. Chalco Solidaridad in the state of Mexico. She is an active member of UD. Estrellita. Ana Lilia has been selling robes, overalls, and reflective vests. She began selling these articles out of necessity, now that her children have started school and her husband’s income was not enough to cover expenses. Due to her economic situation, she decided to look for a loan. She learned of Fundación Realidad through a friend, who invited her to join the group. This motivates her very much because it provides her the opportunity of obtaining a loan to invest in merchandise and increase her earnings. This way she will be able to become more economically solvent. Her priority at the moment is the education of four of her five children. They currently attend school; her fifth child is only a year old. Ana Lilia hopes to better her quality of life through this business and she is very grateful for this assistance. The other members of the group are: Ma Trinidad – Shoe and grill sales Virginia – Waterproofing FabioL. – Beauty products (catalog sales) Maria – Paper goods Maria – Beauty products (catalog sales) Edith – Clothing and shoes Irma – Appetizers Gloria – Beauty products (catalog sales) Guly – Beauty products (catalog sales) Maximina – Groceries Carolina – Shoe sales (catalog)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Korb's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Korb S. is 39 years old and the leader of this group loan. She has been selected by the members, who are located in Kor village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Korb S. and her husband, Mr. Pharn Set, are farmers who own a 2.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Korb S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire a farm laborer. Aside from farming, Mr. Pharn Set also works as a construction worker for which he receives a small salary to support his family. The couple has four children; three attend the local school while the youngest is a year old. Mrs. Thyda Kem and Mrs. March Eam, who are group guarantors, are also presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire a farm laborer

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
For the second time, Diana P. is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI. This loan will be used to support her hog-raising business. She will sell the hogs that she has raised over the past four months to people in her village or in the market. The proceeds will be a great source of income that will augment the small and sporadic earnings of her husband, who is a hired laborer and, at times, a fisherman. 

By sustaining a hog business, Diana hopes to have more profit to be able to support the needs of her family, especially her four children whom she considers to be angels. They range in age from two to nine years old and they are Diana’a inspiration to work hard and expand her business. Considering their innocence about how poverty can affect their future, she gains strength to hold on to her dream of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for her hog business.

loans.name: Swad

texts.en:
Swad B. is a hardworking and very determined businesswoman. She is married to a businessman who is an active partner in the business and they have ten dependents.

Swad was initially financed by her husband and began to trade in foodstuffs and she is now selling household utensils which she has engaged in for eight years.

Swad is in need of a loan to buy more stock and she intends to use the additional proceeds from the loan to educate her children to university level and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more household utensils to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose R. is married to John Kebut. They are both 45 years old and together they have six children aged between 12 and 23. Rose is a resident of Ngolong Village on the outskirts of the town of Kabarnet. 

Rose runs an agro-vet shop which she started three years ago and is her primary source of income. She makes an average profit of KES 4,000 a month from the business; her other income comes from her spouse’s salary. Rose's business is located in Ngolong Trading Centre on the outskirts of Kabarnet, and most of her customers are residents of Ngolong, the neighboring villages and Pemwai Trading Centre.

Rose was introduced to KADET Limited by a client who had already joined KADET and borrowed KES 15,000 as her second loan. Rose plans to use KES 5,000 to purchase DAP fertilizers, KES 5,000 to purchase hybrid maize seeds and beans, and the remaining KES 5,000 for dairy meals and pesticides. Rose has never before borrowed from any microfinance institution.

Rose plans to use the profit from the business to expand it to maintain her growing clientele as it is the only business of its kind in the centre. Her dreams and hopes are to expand her business and give her children the best education possible. She also hopes that she will be able to support the less fortunate in society, especially in her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, maize, bean seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina  tiene 65 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Miguel, es casada vive con el esposo, un hijo de 23 años, la nieta de 18 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y frijoles.
La Señora se dedica hace cinco años a la venta de tamales de gallina, el negocio lo aprendió cuando era soltera junto a la madre, las ventajas es que hay mucha personas de la zona que la conocen y tiene clientes por lo cual las ventas son positivas, le gusta mucho el negocio y es una persona emprendedora, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo, para compra de materiales para elaborar los tamales, ella lo invertirá en: maíz, carne de pollo, frijoles, hojas de planta de quineo, especies, y otros productos para la elaboración de los tamales. 
Este préstamo le servirá para generar ingresos, los cuales le servirán para solventar gastos de alimentación de la familia y otros, los sueños de María son apoyar a su nieta con los estudios hasta que esta sea una persona profesional.
texts.en:
María Cristina is 65 years old and resides in the town of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, a 23 year old son, and an 18 year old granddaughter. María Cristina sells chicken tamales and beans.

She has been selling chicken tamales for five years. When she was single, she learned the business from her mother. Her sales have been positive because she has the advantages of having several customers and being in an area where most of the people know her. María Cristina enjoys her work and is an enterprising person. At the moment she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making tamales such as corn, chicken, beans, banana leaves, spices, and other products.

These funds will help generate more income and enable her to cover the cost of feeding her family and other expenses. María dreams of supporting her granddaughter with her studies until she becomes a working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, beans, banana leaves, spices, and other products

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es: Juan es de 28 años de edad Soltero, tiene cuatro hijos un varón y tres mujeres, se dedica a confeccionar prenda para vestir de diferentes estilos y tallas, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente diez años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para comprar una  máquina para confeccionar sus productos lo que le ayuda mejorar su producción, su primer crédito lo cancelo normalmente.
texts.en:
Juan is 28 years old, single, and has four children, a son and three daughters. He manufactures clothing in different styles and sizes. Juan has approximately ten years of experience in this business. He is requesting his second loan so that he can buy a machine for making his products and improving his productivity. His first loan was repaid correctly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie Y. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Arcelie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arcelie raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Arcelie is just starting her business. In 2010, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elzevir

texts.en:
When Elzevir became a member of Kiva's field partner Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she found that she not only received capital from them, but also her second family in the presence of co-members. That is why she enjoys being a part of it. Now, her 3rd loan will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. She will buy different groceries and many other items that are needed for her business.

Elzevir says she is working hard, not only to have a better life for herself, but also to help her parents and her niece in their needs. She is just hoping to have a long life so that she can do this. Elzevir is hoping that, with ASHI's and Kiva's support, there is a big possibility that the family can fulfill its dreams.

Elzevir’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family's dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a good life, as it currently lives in poverty. Her long term goals are to invest and build a better house for the family and to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To buy groceries and many other items that are needed for her store

loans.name: Teresa Beatriz

texts.es:
Teresa de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así por la gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda   ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa, tiene con su esposo tres hijos. 

Ella comenzó vendiendo algunos artículos para papelería y con la motivación de ayudar con los gastos familiares. Poco a poco fue surtiendo el local con víveres desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h15am hasta las 22:30pm todos los días. . 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas su negocio comprando arroz, papelería, azúcar y otros víveres. Ella quiere tener un negocio bien establecido con una combinación de tienda-papelería y así asegurar la vejez de ella y su esposo
texts.en:
Teresa, age 52, lives in an urban area called “Orquídeas” (Orchids). It was named this way because when it was discovered there was a great quantity of orchids there. She has a small store located in the front of her house. She lives with her husband and their three children. She started selling some stationery items because she wanted to help with the family expenses. Little by little she started stocking her store with supplies. From then on and up until now she works from 6:15 a.m. until 10:30 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to further stock her business by purchasing rice, stationery items, sugar, and other supplies. She wants to have a well established business with a combination store and stationery shop. That way she will ensure her and her husband’s old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stationery items, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mr. Sau Sam Aun Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group has twelve people located I. Trapeang Phlu village I. Takeo province. Born I. 1981, Mr. Sau S. A. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. He is a motorcycle taxi driver earning money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Photha Bieng, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. His problem is that his wife’s field has poor soil. S., to improve production, Mr. Sau S. A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of two children, one of whom is enrolled I. local school, while the youngest one is seven years old. Other members of the group will use their portion of the loan I. various ways.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Asterio

texts.es:
Asterio es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Filoque, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y ubicada a mas de hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas desde hace que era joven. Actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde ha instalado una plantación de maracuyá. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos permanentes los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Asterio desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y algunas medicinas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creíco conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Asterio es un hombre bastante tranquilo y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Asterio is a father and is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the town of Filoque, in a rural area that is located in the agricultural district of Olmos, an area in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than 1 hour 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been working in agriculture since he was young. He has a small piece of farmland where he has planted with passion fruit. This provides him with a steady income that he uses to provide for his family. 

Asterio would like to buy some fertilizer and plant remedies to care for his crop and assure a good harvest. In order to do this, he is requesting a loan of PEN 2,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

Asterio is a very level-headed and responsible man. He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual in his payments.

loans.use: To buy some fertilizer and plant remedies to care for his crop

loans.name: Jinnilyn

texts.en:
Jinnilyn L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 36 years old. Jinnilyn is married and has four children. Her kids are aged 11, 10, 4 and 3. She and her husband are both farmers. They plant and harvest rice crops for sale. Jinnilyn also acquired piglets she is now raising. She is working hard to help provide for her family and sustain her children's education. She dreams to see them finish college and have bright futures.

Jinnilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinnilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jinnilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence S. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 12 children, 8 of whom are in school. She also takes care of three additional family members. Florence has had a bar and a lodge at her home for over 10 years where she works seven days a week. Florence has requested for a loan of 700,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda and beer. She also generates additional income through her rentals. Her main business challenge is defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are educating her children up to university and building more rental houses. Florence lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are electricity, water, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy of beer and soda

loans.name: Surma's Group

texts.en:
On January 31, USAID, Mercy Corps, and local government representatives opened the Veterinary Service and Artificial Insemination Center in Nookat, Osh Oblast. This was the first of nine centers to be opened in southern Kyrgyzstan with support from USAID’s Community Development Initiative (CDI) project, implemented by Mercy Corps. CDI was designed to address problems related to deterioration of livestock health and productivity, which has lead to declines in the quantity and quality of meat and dairy in the region.

Surma S., 52, is a leader of this group. She lives in Kadamjai. She is left with her grandchildren, while all three of her kids left to Russia to earn income.  Recently her son gave her a good idea. He suggested sending his earnings to her, so that she can purchase dairy cattle for starting a small business. But she’s afraid it won’t be enough for a business start-up. So Surma applied for this loan in hopes of increasing the number of cattle and build a house from the proceeds. Surma is confident that she’ll be able to repay it successfully.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene T. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 39 years old. Arlene is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business gathering and selling seaweed at the market. 

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including nets
