loans.name: Claritza Fidelina

texts.es: Claritza Fidelina M. H. de 39 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Con el deseo de poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo, Claritza inicio su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde comercializa recargar electrónicas a celulares y así mismo vende perfumes para hombres y mujeres, las que incluso vende de forma ambulante. Claritza solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de perfumes y así mismo un monto mayor de recargas electrónicas, este ultimo negocio es bastante rentable ya que las ganancias son diarias, lo que es muy positivo para ella.
texts.en:
Claritza Fidelina M. H., 39, lives in Ilopango with her husband and two minor children.  With the desire to provide all necessary help to her husband, Claritza started her own home-based business.  She sells cell phone time recharge cards as well as perfumes for men and women which she also sells door-to-door.

Claritza is asking for a loan to have money to buy larger amounts of perfume as well as a larger amount of electronic recharge cards.  This latter business is quite profitable because profits are daily which is very positive for her.

loans.use: To buy cell phone time recharge cards.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 53 years old, married and has two children who 10 and 14 years old. She makes a living selling livestock and also leads a loan group called Twisungane in the Kinyarwanda language, which means "Let Us Join Together."  The group members run different types of businesses but all of them are determined to expand their small companies and pay back this loan. 

Epiphanie has sold livestock for the last three years and is applying for this loan to buy more livestock to sell. She hopes to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house and improve her family's life.

loans.use: To expand a group of small businesses.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, y reside en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven, y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse una hectárea y media de terreno. En su terreno de cultivo suele sembrar limón. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

José siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José is 49-years-old. He's single and lives in the Tambogrande district of the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

José has worked in agriculture since he was young, and with a lot of hard work he was able to buy a hectare and a half of land. He usually plants lemons on his land. At harvest time he sells them with the plant processors in the area. The business allows him to help sustain his family on a day-to-day basis.

José always pushes himself to get his business ahead. Currently he wishes to use various fertilizers on his land in order to yield a better crop. For this he believed it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles ($550 USD) to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of various fertilizers

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 36 años, vive en casa de sus familiares en compañía de sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, en donde elabora polos y camisas, que son los que más produce y  más demanda tiene, permitiéndole aumentar sus ganancias. En este trabajo, sus hijos la apoyan tanto en la confección como en la comercialización. Ahora el mercado donde vende su mercadería le exige más producción, esto es motivo suficiente para continuar adelante con la proyección de expandir los lugares de venta. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dolores is 36 years old and lives in the home of relatives with her three children. For the past three years she has been manufacturing clothes, such as pullovers and shirts of which she produces most since they are the most in demand. This enables her to increase her income. Her children help with both making and selling the clothes. The current market requires that she produce more. Dolores has sufficient justification to move forward with her project of expanding her sales to more locations.

This is her first loan with MFP. Dolores is happy to know that she has financial support and thanks everyone who approved her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of fabric and thread in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread in bulk

loans.name: Elia Alpina

texts.es: Elia  tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Inicio poco a poco ahorro y de esta manera, hoy en día gracias a todo el esfuerzo que realiza diario es que sigue con este negocio. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Ahora ha ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con este crédito comprará diferentes tipos de productos como leche, carnes, golosinas, avena en paquetes,  utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal. Elia está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Fundación León 2000 por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en: Elia runs her own general store. In the beginning she saved a little at a time and so today, owing to all her daily efforts, she continues to run her business. She has used her fighting spirit, which has always been part of her character, and her will to make ends meet by her own means to turn herself into an entrepreneurial woman. Now she is more experienced, more confident and she is now well known and liked by her customers. She will use this loan to buy different products such as milk, meats, sweets, bags of oats, domestic cleaning utensils and personal hygiene items. Elia is happy with the work that she does each day and is grateful to Fundación León 2000 for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su Octavo ciclo. Tiene por nombre "La cuadrita de mi barrio".
Podemos mencionar la historia de la Sra. Maria Teresa F., quien tiene 45 años de edad, de profesión modista, confecciona ropas y sábanas; tiene su casa en una villa en la zona de San Antonio en la ciudad de Asuncion, como tiene su clientela formada su sueño es ampliar su taller de costura, ya que sus hijas también saben confeccionar y se dedican al mismo oficio.
Ella dice que si uno se pone una meta, con esfuerzo puede lograr alcanzarla.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eighth loan cycle and has the name “La Cuadrita de Mi Barrio” (The Little Corner of My Neighborhood).

The story being presented is that of Sra. Maria Teresa F.. She is 45 years old and a seamstress by profession. Maria makes clothing and bed sheets. She has a house in a section of the city of Asuncion in the San Antonio District where she also has an established customer base. Her dream is to expand her sewing workshop. Her daughters also know how to sew and are devoted to the same trade. She says that if she sets a goal for herself, she puts forth great effort to achieve it.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Carla Jasmin

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería.
  
Aquí conocimos a la señora Carla, tiene 32 años de edad, estuvo casada pero hace dos años se separo y ahora vive  en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal  dos años y le gusta el compañerismo que hay en el mismo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en la casa de sus padres hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta  las 15h00, deja a crédito  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Madres para un Futuro Mejor' (Mothers for a Better Future) community bank meets in 24 De Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  This canton is known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, the variety of its fauna and also for its kind and hard-working people who mainly work in farming and livestock raising.

Here we meet 32 year-old Carla.  Carla was previously married but separated from her husband two years ago and now lives in her parents' home.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it for the camaraderie.

Carla's business is selling all types of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her parents' home to customers who come to her.  She works every day from 9.00am to 3.00pm, leaves her goods on credit and collects payment every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every fortnight or every month, depending on what she needs.  She tells us that she has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.

Carla will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear and other clothes.  Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia D. Quispicanchis y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 27 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. mates, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción como cemento, arena y yeso para construir su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the 'Las Amistosas' community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchis procince, in Cusco department.

Juana is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling maté beverages.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor from 9.00am to 9.00pm.  Through her business she manages to get her children ahead in life.  

Juana would like to build her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster to build her home.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and plaster to build her home

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  She is 32 years old, a single mother of one child.  

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy dairy cows.

In future, Esther hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy  dairy cows.

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Priscar D. is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.
 
She operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and friends. She also makes natural juice for sale, which brings her another source of living. 

Priscar faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of constructing her own house in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells provisions and doughnuts at Abura near Brasi. She is married and has eight dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. Efua has been selling doughnuts for seven years. She assists her husband with providing the basic needs of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to fry doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to fry doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y  cenas y también vende gaseosas, cervezas y chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.                                                  
                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the communal bank "Munay Tika" located in the district and province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as selling sodas, beer and chicha (a corn based drink).  She works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm.  This business helps her to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her restaurant service so she is requesting a loan to buy products to prepare and sodas and beer.                                                    
                     
Señora Maria is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase products to prepare in her restaurant as well as soda and beer.

loans.name: Saory

texts.en:
Saory, age 57, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of $2.3 per day to help cover the family expenses. She also raises chickens at home to generate more income for her family. The family is also assisted by one of her daughters, who is a tailor at a garment factory, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Saory is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase equipment to refine rice wine to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy equipment to refine rice wine to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, hard-working, ambitious and innovative. She is married and blessed with five children aged; 25, 19, 18, 18 and 15 years. She currently sells tea leaves, ginger and coffee. Prior to this, she used to sell clothes. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to grow her business.

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business and become financially stable. She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tea leaves, ginger and coffee.

loans.use: To buy ginger, tea leaves and coffee.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus  tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda la cual quiere surtir con más productos para hacerse D. más clientes y obtener más ganancias, ella quiere estar adelante D. su competencia. María Concepción piensa que el inicio D. su riqueza y felicidad estará al final D. su duro trabajo y dedicación quiere ver crecer su negocio y por eso se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como golosinas, pan, productos instantáneos, lácteos, embutidos, bebidas entre otros; así estará un paso más cerca D. cumplir su meta. María Concepción tiene la esperanza que con esto lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y les llevara seguridad  económica a su hogar.
texts.en: María Concepción is forty-five years old.  She owns her own home and lives with her life companion and three children.  She owns a small store that she wants to stock with more products in order to obtain more customers and earn more income.  She wants to be ahead of her competition.   María Concepción thinks that the beginning of her wealth and happiness will be at the end of her hard work and dedication.  She wants to see her business grow so she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow her to buy products such as sweets, bread, instant products, dairy products, cold cured meat, beverages, and other products.  In this way, she will be a step closer to completing her goal.  María Concepción hopes that this loan will enable her to give her family a better quality of life and bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy sweets, bread, instant products, dairy products, cold cured meat, and beverages.

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 42-year-old single woman, who started doing art work in 2007. It was a hobby that she finally improved and insisted on developing. At the beginning of her working life, Nabiha worked in selling clothes, but she had a dream to make come true, and she saved a small amount of money that helped in changing her career. 

Nabiha is a talented artist. In addition to her drawings, Nabiha also works at preparing baby & wedding souvenirs, and that's why she's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to buy necessary materials to be ready for requested baby souvenirs. 

Nabiha likes her new career a lot and hopes to keep on developing it more and more. She hopes she stays capable of filling her customers needs and requests.

She hopes she can make a big exhibition for her drawings in the future and become well known in the region.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to make requested baby souvenirs.

loans.name: Jentex

texts.en:
Jentex is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Jentex has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy blouses and t-shirts for sale.
Jentex is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jentex hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses and t-shirts for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 50 years old and married to David.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to diversify her sources of income, so she will use the loan amount to buy clothes to sell and open up a boutique in Ndunyu Njeru town.

In future, Elizabeth hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru and also open more branches of her boutique.

loans.use: to open a boutique

loans.name: Pio Agustin

texts.es: Este señor es originario del poblado de telica y vive en el reparto Félix Pedro Carrillo, su profesión es maestro de primaria, actualmente se está desempeñando como coordinador técnico en la delegación del ministerio de educación y deporte telica, con 4 años de efectuar dicha actividad , su núcleo familiar está compuesto por 4 personas él , su esposa y 2 hijas las que estudian carrera universitarias en la cuidad de león, este señor ha obtenido con la empresa 8 financiamientos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, este último está siendo atravez del convenio firmado de financiamiento con el MINED telica
texts.en:
This gentleman is from the town of Telica, and lives in the Félix Pedro Carrillo neighborhood.  He is a primary school teacher, and at present is acting as Technical Coordinator in the Telica office of the Ministry of Education and Sport. He has been doing this job for 4 years. 

His immediate family is composed of 4 people: himself, his wife, and 2 daughters who are studying at university in the city of León. 

He has 8 previous loans with the institution, which have helped him to improve his standard of living.  This latest loan is being made through the financing agreement signed with the Ministry of Education, Telica.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as corn, rice, beans, cooking oil, soap, sugar, as well as firewood.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian, 39, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Julito, a foreman, and mother to her five children. One is already working and two are in college & in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lilian operates a tailoring/sewing business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she also sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilian hopes her business grows and she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a businessman aged 32. He is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last year, he has been managing a cafeteria to earn a living. He has managed to keep his business going because of his hard work and determination.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike because he wants to start a motorbike transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхурахон трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Она 11 лет занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Машхурахон мать 4-х детей и любящая жена. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе. Машхурахон  два раза в месяц едет за товаром и продает на местном рынке, она продает ткани для женских платьев. У Машхурахон много клиентов, которые довольны ее обслуживанием. Свой бизнес она считает прибыльным. Она заботливая мать, и постоянно помогает детям и близким. Для развития бизнеса ей нужна сумма в размере 13500 сомони, после получения, которых она  купит новые ткани для женщин. Машхурахон  надеется этим принести пользу и женщинам и в семейный бюджет. Она надеется, что вы поддержите ее и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Mashhurahon is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She has been involved in an entrepreneurship for 11 years.  Mashhurahon is a mother of four children and is a loving wife.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Mashhurahon travels for her merchandise twice per month and sells it at the local market.  She sells fabrics for women's dresses.  Mashhurahon has many customers, who are satisfied with her service.  She considers her business to be profitable.  She is a caring mother and always helps her children and relatives.  In order to develop her business, she needs a sum of 13500 somoni, which she plans to use to buy new fabrics for women.  Mashhurahon hopes to bring good to both women and to the family budget.  She hopes that you will support her and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, vive en el caserio la Cuchilla, ahi tiene vaR. clientes que le prefieren porque la calidad de los productos que vende es buena y los precios son accesibles para las personas que viven en dicho caserio.
Rosa todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para atender a su familia y luego abre su negocio para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frijoles, azucar, manteca, arroz, tortillas, refrescos, jugos, aceite, candelas, fosforos, churros, sopas, condimentos, huevos, cereal, avena, confites, cafe, pan, galletas y otros productos.
Rosa es madre de 3 hijos, los  cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
Rosa en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa, age 49, is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business of selling everyday consumer products. She has a store inside of her home in the village of Cuchilla. Rosa has several customers in this village who prefer to do business with her because of the good quality of the products she sells and the affordable prices. She wakes up every day at 4am so that she can attend to her family before opening her business to her customers.

This loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, lard, rice, tortillas, soft drinks, juices, oil, candles, matches, donuts, soups, condiments, eggs, cereal, oats, candy, coffee, bread, cookies, and other products. Rosa is the mother of three children who attend school in the community. In her free time, she raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo is a local farmer as well as a pig raiser. She has been engaged in this business for a long time. Through this, she can generate approximately $2.50 per day. Presently she lives with her husband and one child in Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband always works alongside her on the rice field, especially during the rainy season. Moreover, he is a Khmer white wine distiller. He has run this business well, and it is located in his own home. This couple try very hard to raise their child and satisfy their family’s needs. Keo wants to expand her farmland and increase her rice products, which can provide her with more profit. Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva to supplement her capital to buy a plot of land from her neighbor. This loan will help this family increase their income. With the increase in income, she’ll save it for the education of her child and for the growth of the business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land from her neighbor.

loans.name: Abba

texts.fr:
ABBA HABITE AU SENEGAL DANS LA REGION SUD AGE DE 35 ANS ENSEIGNANTS MARIE .IL A 3 ENFANTS ,2 SONT A L'ECOLE LE PLUS GRAND FAIT LE CM1 LE SECOND FAIT CI ET LE PLUS PETIT RESTE A LA MAISON AVEC SA MAMAN.AVEC CE CREDIT ABBA ACHETE DES FOURNITURES SCOLAIRE ET FRAIS D'INSCRIPTION DES ENFANTS.
ABBA FAIT UN BON ENCADREMENT DE SES ENFANTS POUR LEUR REUSSITE DANS L'AVENIR.
texts.en:
Abba is a 35-year-old teacher who is married and lives in southern Senegal. He is the father of 3 children, 2 of whom attend elementary school. The eldest is in fourth grade and the middle child in second grade. The youngest child stays at home with his mother.

Abba is requesting this loan so that he can buy school supplies and pay his children's school enrolment fees. He wants to give his children a good foundation for a successful future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and pay enrolment fees.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Luz has a computer shop that provides internet and online games. The picture was taken outside her house. She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her computer shop.

Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her computer shop.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a 27-year-old married woman with two children ages 6 and 5. Daniela is engaged in farming. She grows rice and fruits to sell. Daniela also raises pigs in her backyard. She does her best to support her husband in providing for their needs.

Daniela has requested a loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers, and farm inputs. She hopes to have a progressive business in the future. She also hopes to save for her childrens' education.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds, fertilizers, and farm inputs.

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele is 47 years of age, married and has 5 children.

Pele owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has had many years of experience in this business. Pele needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Pele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Pele's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
El socio Omar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 36 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años.


El socio  se dedica al comercio minorista en la modalidad de compra y venta de materiales de construcción como son piedra, arena, ladrillos, tejas entre otros, el socio también esta estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho, el socio trae los materiales del poblado de piñipamapa, de huacarpay y de Abancay. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra d emateriales de construccion varios como tejas, arena, piedras.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Omar belongs to the Nueva Luz del Mañana" communal bank, of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco province, Cusco department. He is 36, lives with his partner, and has two children, ages seven and four.

The borrower works in the retail trade, through the buying and selling of construction materials, such as stone, sand, bricks, tiles and other things. 

The borrower is also studying for a law degree. He brings the materials from the village of Piñipamapa, from Huacarpay, and from Abancay.

He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of various construction materials, such as tiles, sand, and stone.
 
The borrower is grateful for the opportunity he has been given, and promises to make his payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy construction materials, such as tiles, sand, and stone.

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он заботливый отец и примерный семьянин. Чтобы содержать свою семью он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур: пшеницы и ячменя также занимается предоставлением услуг по строительству домов и дач. Также он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет хорошие доходы, которые тратит на содержание семьи. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого он хочет получить займ в размере  3000 сомони для приобретения мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на помощь и поддержку. Спасибо!
texts.en: Asror has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is a caring father and an exemplary family man.  In order to support his family, Asror is involved in growing agricultural crops, such as wheat and barley, and is also involved in proving construction services to build homes and country homes.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Asror earns a good income, which he spends on supporting his family.  He wants to expand his business.  For this purpose, he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to purchase small livestock.  Asror relies on your help and support.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  Socorro es una señora trabajadora humilde que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas verdes, enchiladas rojas, sopes, tacos dorados  y empanadas.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Francisco   quien  la apoya en todo  lo que se pueda como barrer y limpiar las mesas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  la compra de chiles verdes, chiles secos, pollos, ajos y cebollas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla  en todo  y seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Socorro is a hardworking, humble woman who sells traditional Mexican dishes such as green enchiladas, red enchiladas, sopes, hard tacos, and empanadas.

She is happily married to her husband, Francisco, who supports her as much as he can in ways such as sweeping and cleaning tables.

She asked for this loan to buy green chiles, dried, chiles, chicken, garlic, and onions.

She thanks the Foundation for supporting her in everything and helping her get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy chiles, onions, garlic, and tomatoes to make food

loans.name: Romy

texts.en: Romy is from Bolos, Siquijor. He and his wife has a hog raising business and earns a living doing hog raising activities. Recently, Romy availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins and hopes to have healthy hogs. Romy deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, aged 41, is a married mother of four children, two of whom rely on her. Living in Kandal province, she earns a living through harvesting rice crop for others for a fee and raising fish. 
This is the third time for her with VisionFund and past loans have enabled her to support her children’s studying and to cover all expenses in family. Now, she is asking for a loan to pay for tuition fees for his son-in-law. She hopes that this loan will enable him to have chance to study General Medical.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for his son-in-law.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy K. is a lady who believes in hard work, she joined Life in Africa in August 2005 and ever since she has worked hard to make ends meet in her life. She has since scheduled herself to both her jobs, selling her shop of ladies fashions and also working for the bracelet project for the Invisible Bracelet Campaign at Life in Africa.

She wants a loan to restock her shop with new fashions so that she can be able to capture more customers. She needs a loan of Ushs. 800,000 and her budget is indicated below.

  • 1 bale of ladies' Cotton skirts @ 200,000
  • 1 bale of ladies' silk blouses @ 170,000
  • 1 Bale of ladies' cotton dresses @ 180,000
  • 1 bale of ladies'double breast coats@ 220,000
  • Transportation @ 30,000

She wants to repay this loan in 12 months at a rate of Ushs.80,000 and her expenses verses income is Ushs.225,000. She saves Ushs.80,000 per month on her account.

She has designated the community impact portion of the interest she pays to support Life in Africa's Internet4Change Team, who need more computers. Read more about Joy at http://lifeinafrica.com/4/joyK.

loans.use: Restocking shop for ladies' garments

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has 6 years of experience crafting tables, chairs, and chests of drawers. He learned the craft working for his uncle, who had a workshop. His uncle fell ill and mentioned to Jimmy the possibility of his taking over the business. Little by little he paid for the machines, and with the business’s two employees he succeeded in moving the business ahead and paying for his own studies. The workshop, located in his uncle’s house, functions from 7 am til 6 pm, Monday through Saturday, and Sunday when there is sufficient demand.

Jimmy wants the loan in order to buy raw materials such as wood and to craft orders he currently has in hand.

Jimmy is single and 25 years old. He currently lives with his aunt and uncle. He succeeded in graduating as an Auditor de Central de Gestion (management) and hopes to practice this profession when his business is stable. He needs the loan so that he can invest in and begin to generate earnings. In the future he hopes to be able to become independent from his family and have his workshop in his own home. He believes with his work he will achieve those goals.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy tiene una experiencia de 6 años en la elaboración de mesas, sillas, anaqueles, actividad que la adquirió de su tío que tenia un taller y trabajaba para el. Su tío se enfermo y le comenta a el la posibilidad de asumir las riendas del negocio. Poco a poco le fue pagando las maquinas del negocio y el ya sabiendo la actividad contrata 2 personas y con ellas a logrado sacar adelante el taller y pagarse también sus estudios. El taller funciona de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. en el domicilio de su tío de lunes a sábado y cuando tiene demanda hasta los domingos. Jimmy desea el crédito para poder comprar materia prima como es la madera y elaborar pedidos que tiene al momento. Jimmy es soltero tiene 26 años y actualmente vive con sus tíos, el también estudiaba y logro graduarse de Auditor de Central de Gestión, titulo que espera comenzar a practicarlo una vez que el negocio este ya estable por lo que necesita el crédito para poder invertir y comenzar a generar ganancias. A futuro espera poder ya separarse de su familia y poder tener su taller en su domicilio y piensa que con su trabajo lo va ha lograr.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in raw material such as wood

loans.name: Onajon

texts.en:
Onajon has had her business for 4 years. She is married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a working migrant in Russia. When he left, all the responsibilities of providing for the children and taking care of the house fell on her shoulders.

She used an initial capital investment of $150 to start a business selling men’s underwear. She has expanded her stock of goods and is now selling men’s clothes. She will use the loan for a trip to a wholesale market in Kyrgystan, where she intends to buy summer shirts. The quality of goods sold in that market is better, and she will save money by not buying the goods locally.

loans.use: Purchase of summer shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her business by diversifying her stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria U. is 24 years old, and happily married with 2 children.  She is a farmer and she learned the act of farming from her mother.  She specializes in rice and yam production.  She now needs additional funds to enable her to buy more yams to sell, and chemicals for planting.  She hopes to expand her business with the above funds.

loans.use: To buy more yams & chemicals for sale & planting

loans.name: Ivan Rafael

texts.es:
Ivan is married and has two children; his wife stays at home. He started this business to be able to bring in a steady income and to have something of his own. His main needs were covering the necessities of his family, offering them a better quality of life, and trying to assure that the future would bring them some economic security. He started his business about two years ago, and decided on this business because he had the ability to grill meat and he enjoyed doing it. He decided to make and sell tacos and grilled steak. Little by little he has increased his sales and his clientèle, and he is very pleased with his gains.

Because of this, Ivan is requesting a loan of $275 USD to invest in the purchase of raw ingredients so he can offer a wider variety of products on his menu. He is offering to pay off the loan in 4 months. He and his family thank you very much for your support in helping his business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ivan esta casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar. Él inició este negocio para poder tener un ingreso fijo y algo propio, su principal necesidad fue poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y trata de lograr de que en el futuro pueda brindarles cierta seguridad económica a ellos. Inició su negocio aproximadamente dos años atrás y se decidió a este negocio por que tenía la habilidad para la preparación de carnes a la parrilla y le gusta hacerlas, así que decidió hacer y vender tacos y carne asada, ahora poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y sus clientes y esta muy contento con sus logros.

Por ello, Ivan está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para invertir en la compra de materia prima y poder brindar una mayor variedad de productos en su menú, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients for his business

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She sells clothing and shoes. In addition, she sells drinks such as soft drinks and beers of all brands. With her earnings, she helps her husband with the household expenses and with the education of thier children.

She's had this business for more than 8 years and has a loyal customer base who sometimes give her orders. Her main provider of shoes is found in Asunción, the capital. She's being doing business with them for more than 5 years. Some of the merchandise that she sells include: t-shirts, shorts, shirts, skirts, children's clothing and different types of shoes.

She would like a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise, because in this way, she can receive the best discounts from her providers and can increase her profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Mirna tiene 29 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y zapatos, además como actividad adicional, vende bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas de todas las marcas. Con todos estos ingresos ella ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos.

El negocio lo tiene hace más de 8 años y posee clientela fija a quienes en algunos casos le vende sobre pedido, su proveedor principal de zapatos se encuentra en la capital Asunción con quien ya opera a crédito desde hace más de 5 años. Entre las mercaderías que vende podemos citar remeras, shorts, camisas, faldas, ropa para niños, y diferentes tipos de calzados.

Ella desea un crédito con el que podrá comprar más mercaderías al por mayor, ya que de esta forma, ella obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores y aumenta el margen de sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, skirts, shirts, children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fredy Gustavo

texts.es:
Mr. O. works selling natural drinks (fruit-based and milk-based) prepared by himself in his home. Once he prepares them, he carries them in a cooler with ice and sells them walking through the city of Leon.

It is important to point out that he has had this business for 7 years, starting with a capital of C$200.00, from his own personal savings.

The conditions in which he carries on his business are difficult, because he sells on the sidewalk around the market, and he has the cooler on the floor with an umbrella to block the sunlight. But he has hope that in the future he will be able to have his own stand inside the market.

Ceprodel has offered him unconditional financial support for 12 months now, with a total of 7 loans. The benefits from these loans have been the growth of his business, allowing him to offer a higher quality of drinks, as well as improving his quality of life and home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor O. se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales preparados por el mismo en su casa de habitación siendo estos de diferentes sabores (fruta y leche), una vez preparados los lleva en un termo con hielo y los vende ambulante la ciudad de León.

Es necesario señalar que tiene 7 años de tener el negocio iniciándolo con un capital inicial de C$200.00 producto de ahorros personales que él hacía

Las condiciones de la venta de su negocio son difíciles ya que vende a orillas de la acera en los alrededores del mercado y el termo lo tiene en el suelo con una sombrilla que le cubre del sol, pero tiene la esperanza de futuro de poder tener su propio tramo dentro del mercado.

Ceprodel le ha brindado su apoyo financiero incondicional hace 12 meses llevando actualmente 7 créditos en su record crediticio

El beneficio que ha tenido en estos créditos ha sido el crecimiento en su negocio con refrescos de mejor calidad, como también ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y mejorado su vivienda dignamente.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the preparation of natural drinks (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Mevleta

texts.en:
Mevleta is 43 years old and she is from Gornje Dubrave, a village near Živinice. She is a widow and she lives with her 12-year-old granddaughter. Mevleta has a daughter who is divorced and unemployed. Mevleta gets a pension and monthly stipend for her granddaughter in the amount of US$ 460. She has cows and she sells fruits and vegetables.

With this loan that Mevleta is requesting through MCO and Kiva in the amount of US$ 450, she will buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. Her wish is to increase her monthly income and thus the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: José Omar

texts.es:
Jose is 31 years old and lives with his family in the community of San Caralampio, a rural zone where they grow primarily pineapple, vegetables and citrus fruits. Jose has been cultivating pineapple for 5 years, perfecting the production process and harvesting a high quality product to sell. This has been possible because of the work he does after every harvest to make each process productive. The next pineapple harvest is for May, and Jose needs to purchase fertilizer and other materials for the production process to once again have a successful harvest.

José tiene 31 años, habita con su familia en la comunidad San Caralampio, zona rural en donde se dedican a producir mayormente piña, hortalizas y cítricos, debido a las características propias de la zona permite los productos se asientan de manera positiva. El señor tiene plantaciones de piña, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y se ha ido perfeccionando en todo el proceso de producción, permitiéndole cosechar un producto de buena calidad, para su debida comercialización. Esto ha sido posible debido al mantenimiento post cosecha y al seguimiento que le da a cada proceso productivo. La próxima cosecha de piña es para el mes de mayo, el señor necesita comprar fertilizantes, abonos, urea y carburo, con el fin de tener un buen producto.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZER AND OTHER MATERIALS NEEDED TO HAVE A SUCCESS PINEAPPLE HARVEST IN MAY.

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum Toy and Mr. Chap Y. (he is pictured alone because his wife wasn't available at the time) live in the Chrok Poun Village, Kompong Cham Province, where they grow vegetables to sell in the market, earning about $4 per day. They have five children, one of whom contributes about $1.50 per day to the family by working in the garment factory; the rest are students.

They work very hard everyday to sustain the family and now ask for a loan of $300 to increase their working capital in vegetable growing and to buy jackfruit trees to sell fruit to customers in the market. They thank Kiva and promise to be prompt in their loan payment.

loans.use: To increase their working capital in vegetable growing and to buy jackfruit trees to sell fruit to customers in the market.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Samuel M., a young man of 23 years, single, no children, was born in Catembe-Maputo. He attends 10th grade, and supports two brothers. He explains that he has always lived with his parents, studied, and found ways early on to help the family by selling essential products in the yard of the family home, which is in the Chali district of Catembe (across the bay from Maputo). For the last four years, he has also worked for Generics & Specialists Lda. selling pharmaceuticals. For 2 years he has been running his grocery store on good common sense; he has no business or other degree. The store has one salaried employee, has a business license, and is open from 8:00a.m. to 9:30p.m.

Samuel became acquainted with Hluvuku through friends and colleagues, and has already repaid his first loan with no trouble. With a loan of 10,000 MT, he intends to bolster his grocery store with products such as rice, beans, peanuts, corn meal, and soft drinks. He acquires his products in Catembe and rents a wagon to transport them. The best periods are weekends in the summer and at the end of the month, when supply is better. His daily revenue is 1,000 MT, and his most profitable product is soft drinks.

According to Samuel, the business has reached a good rhythm, with a monthly profit of 2,000 MT. With the business profits, he is able to support his family, increase volume, make home improvements, and put away savings. In the future, with additional loans, he intends to expand and diversify the products that he can offer his customers. He is thrilled with the credit extended to him, because it has substantially improved his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Cliente: Samuel M. Localização – Bairro Chali, Catembe Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes Início: 27/03/08 Fim: 20/07/09 Samuel M. jovem solteiro de 23 anos, nasceu na Catembe-Maputo, está frequentando a 10ª classe, sustenta 2 irmáos e ainda não tem filhos. Relata que sempre viveu com os pais, estudava e desde cedo preocupou-se em arranjar formas de ajudar a família vendendo produtos de 1ª necessidade no quintal de sua casa, e actualmente trabalha como promotor de produtos farmacéuticos na Generics & Specialists Lda a 4 anos. Faz o negócio a 2 anos sensivelmente e não tem nenhuma formação e emprega um trabalhador assalariado. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku de colegas e amigos e já teve o 1º empréstimo que pagou sem sobressaltos. Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00MT pretende reforçar a mercearia com produtos como: arroz, feijão, amendoim, farrinha de milho e refrigerantes. O estabelecimento é aberto as 8 horas e encerra as 21:30mn e adquire os produtos na catembe e aluga carro para transportá-los e o melhor período é aos fins de semana, verão e final do més onde a procura é maior. A receita diária é de 1.000MT e que dá mais lucro são refrigerantes e tem registo no seu negocio. O negócio segundo relata está num bom ritmo e margem lucro mensal é 2.000MT e com os rendimentos do negócio consegue sustentar a família, aumentar volume de negócio, reabilitar sua casa e poupancas. No futuro pretende reforçar e diversificar os produtos que oferece aos clientes e provavelmente vai precisar de empréstimo e duma maneira geral está entusiasmado com o crédito porque melhorou substancialmente o negócio.

loans.use: To increase and diversify stock in his business

loans.name: Gam D 2028-5 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Martha C.. She is in the business of selling charcaol. Martha is 45 years old and is a widow. She has two children, 20 and 27.

Each week, Martha makes approximately 90 Sudanese pounds in profit; with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Martha is joined in her group by Cilran S., Paulina J., Dina E. and Louis M.. Cilran sells breads; Paulina operates a business selling vegetables; Dina also sells vegetables. All three wish to expand their businesses. Louis sells goods at a shop; she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria M. O. is a native of the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. Currently, engaged in providing well-being to her two school-aged daughters, she looks for a way to invest in the reconstruction of her home, which has suffered from many strikes to it with the passing of time that have prevented it from being inhabitable.

She initiated the reconstruction of part of her home, and today she requests a loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials and to pay for the manual labor. For this reason, she trusts that she will receive this loan so that she can improve the living conditions of her young daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria M. O. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente, comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos pequeñas hijas en edad escolar, busca la manera de invertir en la reconstrucción de su vivienda por lo que a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, ha sufrido azotes que impiden que se habite en ella.

Inició la reconstrucción por parte de su vivienda y hoy en día solicita a Ceprodel el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y para el pago de la mano de obra. Por este motivo es que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus pequeñas.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and pay for the manual labor.

loans.name: Timothée

texts.fr:
Monsieur K. Timothée est né en Avril 1980 à Hédjékopé dans la préfecture de VO.
Marié et père de deux enfants, il est évangéliste. Très dynamique, il  est doué dans la production d’huile de palme. Il sollicite un crédit pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Timothée K. was born in April 1980 in Hedjekope in the prefecture of Vo, Togo. Married and the father of two children, Timothée is a minister. He is very active and gifted at producing palm oil. He is seeking a loan to support his famiy and improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Hana

texts.fr: Madame K. Hana est née en 1968 à Agomé Tomégbé . Son activité principale est la vente de sandalettes et du savon dans la localité. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle maîtrise bien son activité. Bonne gestionnaire, elle arrive à associer d’autres petits commerce. Elle partage les charges du foyer par les revenus qu’elle tire de son activité. Elle sollicite un  crédit qui va lui permettre de renforcer son activité en achetant en grande quantité les produits.
texts.en:
Madame Hana K. was born in 1968 in Agomé Tomégbé. She sells sandals and soap in her hometown. She is the married mother of three children, and handles her occupation well. Her knack for management has allowed her to begin trading in other sundries as well. She helps meet the financial needs of her family with the money she earns from this job. She is requesting a loan, which will allow her to buy a large quantity of products and increase her business.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of sandals and other goods

loans.name: Therese Abeyonhou

texts.fr: Dama H. Therese Abeyonhou est née le 1er Septembre 1960 à AKPRO-MISSERETE dans le département de l'OUEME au sud du BENIN. Veuve ayant à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés, elle se fait aider par une domestique nommée Suzanne pour la vente de tomates fraîches et du piment. Sa domestique est ambulante et vent dans les quartiers environnants tandis qu'elle même vend dans le marché de quartier DEGAKON. Elle s'approvisionne au marché HOUEGBO dans le département de l'Atlantique à 70 kilomètres de Cotonou. La tomate et le piment lui reviennent moins chers dans ce marché. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Therese Abeyonhou H. was born on September 1, 1960 in Akpro-Misserete in the Oueme province of southern Benin. A widow with four school-aged children, she and her domestic employee Suzanne work together selling fresh tomatoes and peppers. Suzanne handles itinerant sales in nearby districts, while Therese has set up shop in the Degakon district market. She procures her stock from Houegbo in Atlantique province, 70 kilometers from Cotonou, as tomatoes and peppers are less expensive at that market. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 baskets each of fresh tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Gladith

texts.es:
La señora Gladith, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Reinitas”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y algunos abarrotes. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Porvenir Mz. C Lt.  7. Se inicia en el negocio  porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobretodo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y de tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, así como papel higiénico en paquetes, huevos en casilleros, los cuales son productos muy requeridos por sus clientes. 

Gladith tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Más adelante desea implementar su negocio con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gladith belongs to the credit group “In the Mean Time (The Queens)”. She lives in the region and province of San Martin district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to the sale of refreshments and snacks. The business is located in her home. She began this business because she needed to generate more income to compensate for the increasing needs of her children, and above all their schooling. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 monthly installments, she will buy bottled water, a variety of sodas, toiletries, and eggs, all of which are in high demand from her clients. Gladith is 56 and lives with her husband and children. She is a very responsible and resilient woman with the motivation to help herself and her children ahead. In the future she would like to open an actual store selling non-perishables.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottled watter, soda, toiletries, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Huế năm nay 50 tuổi, gia đìnhchị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 1997 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay 500.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau 6 tháng dự án cho thu nhập 1.200.000đ. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi lợn gà hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ lương  của các con nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ kinh tế gia đình chị Huế đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm 7 con lợn về nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs Huế is 50 years old. Her familiy includes 3 already grown-up children. In 1997, she joined the Fund and borrowed 500.000đ to buy animals to breed. After 6 months, the venture provided an income of 1.200.000đ. Nowadays, besides the income from pig and chicken farming, the family's revenues have stabilized, through the additional income from all the children. With the current income of 4.000.000đ, the family Huế's economy is improving with every passing day. For the next round, she would like to borrow 15.000.000đ to refurbish the breeding facilities and buy 7 additional pigs to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Yuli Miriam

texts.en:
Yuli is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their child. 

Yuli has a chicken restaurant on the Valdelirios pedestrian street, where her specialties are hamburgers and roasted chicken. She works at the restaurant every night of the week, and sells a variety of drinks during the day. Yuli also sells cosmetics by catalog.  

Yuli needs a loan of 600 soles to buy soda and beer.

Yuli’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build her house on and to help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: Buy soda and beer to resell

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha S. est un commerçant ambulant qui habite Kandialang au Sud de Ziguinchor. Avec sa bicyclette ce brave homme satisfait à la demande sociale de sa petite famille. Il demande ce prêt pour acheter davantage de marchandises et réaliser un peu plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Moustapha S. is an itinerant merchant who lives in the Kandialang district located on the southside of Ziguinchor. With his bicycle, this good and honest man is meeting the demands of his small family. He is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise and to realize a little more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena P. M. es madre soltera, ella vive con sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 4 años en su hogar, ella trabaja como camarera en un motel desde hace 4 años y este empleo le proporciona los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus hijos.
La señora Magdalena está solicitando un préstamo para construir acabados interiores en su casa, para que de esta manera ella les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos un hogar más cómodo para vivir.
texts.en:
Magdalena P. M. is a single mother. She lives with her two children. They have lived in their home for four years. She has worked as a maid in a motel for four years and this job provides her the necessary income to support her children. Magdalena is requesting a loan to construct interior finishes in her home so that she may offer her children a more comfortable home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct interior finishes.

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.en:
Gulnoz A. is a 41 year old woman. She is married and the mother of five children.  Aside from caring for her family and her home, Gulnoz has a grocery store which she attends to herself. She began her small business 8 years ago with financial support from her husband who is a farmer. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income.  The business has been gradually growing ever since.  From the profit from her business Gulnoz was able to arrange the wedding of her two elder sons and is  planning to educate the rest of her children and to arrange their weddings too. In order to expand her business she requests for a loan of $ 800 US dollars. Gulnoz is planning to use the loan to purchase a more diverse range of goods to sell. She promises to repay her loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the diversity of goods  for selling

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith V. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Mateo Pumacahua Nº 329 – Pueblo Joven, departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años y es madre 01 hija, que depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su esposo  se inicio vendiendo en su casa,  golosinas, galletas, caramelos.
Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica al servicio de Internet y con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá implementando su negocio con 02 cabinas de locutorio para llamadas telefónicas locales, nacionales e internacionales..

Ambos; ella y su esposo toman las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. Ahora es una Mujer independiente, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Loicith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loicith V. R. belongs to the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace). She lives at Jr. Mateo Pumacahua Nº 329 – Pueblo Joven, San Martín department. She is married, 33 years old, and the mother of 1 daughter who is dependent upon her. With the first loan for S/.300.00, motivated by her husband, she began selling candy, cookies, and caramels from her home. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Today she provides Internet service and with the loan for S/2,500.00 that will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in adding 2 phone booths for local, national and international phone calls. Both she and her husband make the decisions regarding the expenses and income from her business. Now she is an independent woman, more assured, responsible with her loan payments and making her own decisions. Loicith thanks Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install 2 phone cabins

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Etant mariée  avec un monsieur qui est assistant médical avec qui elle a eu  02 enfants, cette dame a commencé depuis 2006 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, plus tard afin de diversifier  son commerce elle a associé à la vente de charbons la vente de bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs. Actuellement son stock de charbons de bois est épuisé aussi elle souhaiterai commencer le commerce de maïs cela lui faciliterai aussi l’approvisionnement pour la vente de bouillie, ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES elle demande son deuxième crédit pour acheter 07 sacs de charbons de bois, 04 sacs de maïs et divers produits nécessaires pour son activité
texts.en:
This woman is married to a gentleman who is a medical assistant, with whom she's had two children. In 2006, she started selling sacks of charcoal, and, later, to diversify her business, she also started selling porridge made out of corn flour. She's currently out of stock of charcoal, and also need to get supplies of corn. She's therefore seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 7 sacks of charcoal, 4 sacks of corn, and other products that she needs for her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of charcoal and 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is married with 3 children. She works as a trader in Siwdo, selling cooked rice. Abena is an experienced business woman and has been involved in her trade since 1997. While Abena is selling her goods, her husband works as a driver in the surrounding areas. She uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses, primarily that of food.

Abena will use the loan to purchase additional rice which she will cook and then sell. With her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest the profits back into her enterprise in order to further her success.

loans.use: To purchase rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 46 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy abnegado y de “mil oficios”, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con una casa propia. De joven se dedicó a realizar los trabajos agrícolas, actividad heredada de sus padres; pero para él la agricultura, algunas veces, es de escasa producción y muchas veces no se recupera lo invertido. Por ello que hace 5 años viene dedicándose a la crianza de cuyes, pero sin dejar sus cultivos de papa, ni alverjas que en ciertas temporadas le son muy rentables. Su mayor tiempo les dedica a sus animales, ya que quiere convertirse en un empresario exitoso. Inició su negocio con cuyes de una raza menor, pero ahora está cambiando a una raza de mejor calidad, participando en todas las ferias agropecuarias para exhibir a sus roedores. Walter nos muestra en la foto, orgulloso, su “cobaya”, de un tamaño considerable. Para la alimentación de sus cuyes siembra alfalfa en sus chacras de riego, ya que con pasar de los meses sus animales se están incrementado y eso le demanda mayor cantidad de pasto. Él está muy feliz porque este negocio le ha permitido relacionarse con ingenieros, de quienes pudo obtener información muy valiosa para mejorar su actividad. Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde todo este tiempo vino pagando de forma muy puntual, asimismo ha cumplido la función de tesorero, cargo que cumplió con mucha honestidad y cabe mencionar que es el único varón en su banco comunal, por lo cual es el más querido por el resto de las socias. En esta oportunidad ha decidido en invertir en la compra de chacras sembradas de alfalfa o avena para alimentar a sus 200 cuyes, así como en la compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Walter is 46 years old. He is a very self-sacrificing head of the family and has "a thousand jobs". He has 3 children and owns his own home. From the time he was young, he has done agricultural work, an activity he inherited from his parents. But for him, agriculture sometimes results in scarce production and many times he does not recoup his investment. For this reason, he has been raising guinea pigs for the past 5 years, though he has not stopped planting potatoes and peas, which in certain seasons are very profitable. Walter dedicates most of his time to his animals, as he wants to become a successful business owner. He started his business with guinea pigs of a lower quality, but now he is upgrading to a lineage of better quality, participating in all of the livestock fairs to exhibit his rodents. In the picture, Walter proudly shows us his female guinea pig, which is quite large. In order to feed his guinea pigs, he plants alfalfa in irrigated plots, since with the passing of the months he has more animals and requires more pasture. He is very happy because this job has enabled him to work with engineers, from whom has is able to obtain very useful information to improve his business. This is the fourth loan that he has taken out from MFP, and he has always paid very punctually. He has also served as the treasurer, a role he performed with great integrity. It is also worth noting he is the only man in his communal bank, and is therefore the favorite of the rest of the female members. With this loan he has decided to purchase fields planted with alfalfa or oats to feed his 200 guinea pigs, as well as fertilizer for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his animals

loans.name: Charmalou

texts.en:
Mrs. Charmalou U. has a business called "Char's Lechón Retailer and Longganiza", selling pork. She is married to Mr. Ibrahim U. and they have been blessed with two children. Her husband is a waiter. Mrs. Charmalou is a hardworking person and a good mother to her two little princesses.

She started with meager capital until she become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative on November 26, 2008. Now she plans to expand her business and she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to be used for additional capital.

loans.use: Capital for Lechón and longganiza business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1803070686) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 6 adult children. To making a living, N. owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $112) a month from these activities.

In 2007, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. N. is now requesting a new loan of 11,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food & drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Taulaai

texts.en: Taulaai F., 48, is married with 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the general public 5 days per week.  Taulaai has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Taulaai’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase plantation supplies and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 42-year-old married man with three children. He owns an amusement center where the village boys come and enjoy their time. Today, Abbas is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a billiard table to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a billiard table

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan F. is a 30-year-old mother of two children ages nine and three years old. Her loving partner and the father of her children, Jerry Gallano, is a fishpond caretaker and sometimes a carpenter. In 2006, Joan joined ASHI in order to have access to credit, which enabled her to put up her own business and own source of income to augment her husband's. 

When Joan started with her fish buy and sell business, she only sold a small volume of fish since her business capital was small. After several loans from ASHI and after showing her good performance in attendance during weekly center meeting, repayment, and business, she was allowed to have a larger loan. Eventually her business grew. The volume of fish she bought and sold increased. She also saved with ASHI every week. 

With Joan's new loan, she plans to add crab, shrimp, and prawn to the variety of fish she sells. Jerry has been very happy for Joan's business since they can work together and have the opportunity to run their own business. Joan and Jerry can't wait for their business and their savings to grow because they want to have a fishpond of their own. Joan is praying that her business will be successful and that she and Jerry will be able to sustain their family's financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja Andrés de 41 años, y sus hijos Carlos de 17 y Brigitte de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, actividad que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que sus hijos están estudiando y por ende tienen más gastos. Lidia comienza su jornada diaria a las 7 de la mañana, tiempo en el cual realiza las tareas domésticas y posteriormente sale a ofrecer su mercadería a sus vecinas, familiares y amigas, las cuales siempre están en espera de alguna novedad. A Lidia le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede conversar, visitar a sus amigas y conocer nueva personas, lo malo es que al final del día termina agotada y otras veces es que algunas clientas no le pagan puntualmente, pero ahora tiene más cuidado con eso y ha mejorado mucho en sus ventas. Este es el tercer préstamo de Lidia con MFP y ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
