Roly tiene 36 años, es madre de una pequeña de 7 añitos, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la crianza de pollos, tiene un pequeño galpón acondicionado en su misma casa y para este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia. A Roly le gusta cuidar muy bien de sus pollos para que lleguen a su tamaño y peso adecuado para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, vende pescado a otras ciudades, esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 5 meses y también le está yendo muy bien. Para el futuro, Roly quiere comprar un terreno para mandar a construir galpones más grandes y mejor implementados que alberguen a una gran cantidad de pollos.
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal, es que hay mucha armonía entre todos los integrantes y están bien comprometidos con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pollos y suficiente alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Roly is 36 years old, mother of a 7 year-old daughter, and lives with her husband in their own house. For the past year, she has been dedicated to breeding chickens, and she has a small, well equipped shed in her own house. The whole family helps to take care of the chickens. Roly enjoys taking good care of her chickens so that they reach the proper size and weight for selling them. As a side job, she sells fish to other cites, and she has been doing this for 5 months and this is also going very well for her. As for the future, Roly wants to buy land that she can use to build larger, better equipped sheds that will accommodate a larger population of chickens. This is her third loan with MFP, and the thing she likes the most about her community bank is that there is a lot of harmony between all the members, and they are very committed to punctuality of their balances. With the money that she has asked for, she will buy more chickens and sufficient food for their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and their food

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena G. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lucena joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: B. Josephine is 48 years old and married with 6 children as she takes care of other siblings. Josephine is a hard working lady and a nurse operating a pharmacy in Kayunga for 12 years. When she had just joined her lending group, her business was still so low but with the help of loans, she has been able to boost it and now she has a lot of variety in what she sells. She helps contribute to the payment of her children’s school fees and in future, she would like to own more land that will be used for agriculture hence more income. At the moment, Josephine needs a loan to be able to buy more medicines for an increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more medicines for more stock in her drug shop.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame  Hawa  H.  est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère  de 5  enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs autres ménages dans le quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école moderne  pour des raisons familiales, (car issue d’une famille de chérifs, son père voyait en l’école une source de déperdition). Elle fréquenta  plutôt l’école coranique qu’elle l’abandonna également tôt. C’est ainsi qu’elle commença à faire des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande sœur  qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle décide  d’évoluer  seule, en optant pour la  vente de légumes, de tubercules et d’épices, au marché château depuis  maintenant 15 ans. Elle  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices,  elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle  est  en relation depuis 24 mois. Après  4 prêts solidaires correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Elle  compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 15 sacs de pommes de terres et 10 sacs d’oignons. Elle  s’approvisionne à Bamako. Madame  Hawa  H.  vend   au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45 000FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de participer aux événements sociaux (mariage, baptême etc.)  Son vœu est d’avoir  une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Madam Hawa Haidara is 34 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in the traditional family with her husband, children and several other households in Darsalam neighborhood of Segou town( fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Unable to attend modern school owing to family reasons( originally from a cheriff family, the father sees school as a source of waste). She rather attended a koranic school which she equally abandoned early. This is how she started to do income generating business by her elder sister who sold food ingredients. After several years of apprenticeship, she decided to develop alone, opting for the sale of vegetables, tubers and spices in the palace market 15 years ago. She has great reputation and major customers. With the intention to increase his business capital in order to make more profit, she turns toward Soro Yiriwaso she 's been in acquaitance with since 24 months ago. After 4 group loans having been repaid correctly, she is on her fisrt individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 15 bags of potatoes and 10 bags of onions. She gets her supplies in Bamako. Madam Hawa Haidara sells for cash and for credit to a clietele composed of women and men. She intends to make a monthly profit of 45 000FCFA. The profit will enable her increase her business capital and to participate in social events( mariage, baptism etc) Her wish is to have a house for renting.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and onions

loans.name: Mrs. Toeur Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of ten people who live in Damrei Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. Toeur T. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who grows rice on a plot of land that she owns. She also sells fresh fish in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Vun, is a fisherman. Mr Vun does not have enough fishing nets, so Mrs. Toeur T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets to support her husband’s fishery. 

Mrs. Toeur T. is 35 years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend the local school; the youngest is too young to attend.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and has 2 children who are both currently at school. She earns income working as a farmer in Norala, South Cotabato, managing a 1.5-hectare rice field. She devotes most of her time to working on the farm in order to be able to support her family. 

Myrna recently joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of PHP12,000. She will use the money to improve her farm's productivity in order to obtain a more plentiful harvest in the future.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Patrick Kinyanjui

texts.en: Patrick is 22 years old, married, and has a two year old son. He transports passengers on the Makongeni-Kiganjo route near Thika town. His business challenge is the poor road transport network in the rainy season, as it is impassable using a motorbike. Patrick will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His goal in life is to own another motorbike and to build a house for his family. He describes himself as honest and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business' motorbike.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Antonio, es cliente en la institucion desde el año pasado, tiene cuatro secuencias trabajando puntual y responsablemente en sus cuotas, el Sr. Vive en la zona de Villa fatima, siendo su ruta de trabajo en la zona sur, su espoda la Sra. Adalit trabaja como niñera en un domicilio en la zona de Sopocachi, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, el saca sus créditos para mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Antonio has been a client in the institution [Emprender] since last year. He has four loan cycles and is punctual and responsible in his payments.

Antonio lives in Villa Fatima zone and his taxi route is in the southern zone. His wife, Adalit, works as a nanny at a home in the Sopocachi zone. In this way, she helps Antonio with the household expenses. They have two school-age children.

This loan will be used for maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her café business

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, hay un sitio muy cercano al Estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, donde se respira el Futbol y vecinos alegres y solidarios que se cuidan entre si, ese es el barrio donde habita Patricia H. A., una joven de 32 años que desde temprana edad le ha gustado ser independiente, por eso inició desde su casa un negocio de elaboración de bolis o bebida congelada y empacada en bolsas plásticas, preparada naturalmente con las mas deliciosas frutas tropicales de nuestra región: la guayaba, el mango, la guanábana, el  coco, el banano, la piña  entre otras. Con estos refrescantes productos conocieron a Patricia en la comunidad, gradualmente fue atrayendo la oferta de  empresas en la comercialización de mercancías a través de guías especializadas; fue así como inició la venta de estas mercancías, visitando clientes a quienes mostraba los productos exhibidos en el catalogo y estos a su vez lo seleccionaban  para que Patricia se lo llevara a la puerta de su casa e iniciaba con ellos un  plan de pagos a crédito con una cuota inicial. En este momento el único capital que soportaba este segundo negocio era el producido por los bolis y casi siempre se quedaba corta en responder con mercancías a sus clientes; fue entonces cuando Ana, su vecina y amiga, percibiendo su capacidad emprendedora y su ya reconocido sentido de responsabilidad en el barrio, le recomendó acercarse a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para que la apoyaran con un crédito y desde entonces no ha dejado de participar en los programas de esta entidad, ella reconoce que este ha sido un capital adicional que ha mejorado su oferta de productos en cantidad y en calidad.
  
A Patricia siempre le ha gustado ser independiente, su cónyuge es policía y  tienen dos hijos menores de edad; su esposo y su cuñada que es docente, le ayudan a seleccionar sus clientela entre sus amigos de trabajo es decir los que mejor pagan;  ella también compra calzado, prendas de plata, oro golfi, electrodomésticos que no están en la guía de productos y que le piden sus clientes; esta es la razón por la cual ellos la prefieren y su negocio se ha extendido, ya que siempre les vende lo que estos le encargan; su actual aspiración es obtener un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar prendas de plata y de oro a solicitud  de los mas rentables.

Para esta joven mujer, el tener un negocio le ha fortalecido su carácter independiente, con sus utilidades ella paga la seguridad social y puede incluir a sus padres; tiene una hermosa  y ordenada vivienda, producto del interés de su esposo y  de ella por vivir cada día mejor; ha logrado también hacer optimas adecuaciones en su casa, como los pisos, la puerta, los closets; le encanta su esposo porque él no limita su capacidad de soñar ni sus decisiones de inversión, pues él reconoce que todo le da un resultado exitoso. 

Patricia H. es una mujer polifacética, ama el trabajo que realiza, por eso también participa en actividades, que apoyan la seguridad alimentaria de familias pobres y estimulan el mejoramiento y la recuperación en los niveles de nutrición de niños con dificultades alimenticias o expuestos a ella; allí de la mano de una organización ubicada cerca de su vivienda, realiza  acciones formativas y enseña a identificar como conseguir alimentos a madres y personas responsables de menores en riesgo alimentario; ha participado en programas de siembra de huertas en los patios de familias especiales,  labores mencionadas con la que obtiene algunos ingresos adicionales que fortalecen  el desarrollo  familiar, pues su sueño está proyectado en ofrecer estudios profesionales y especializados a sus hijos y respecto a su negocio planea desarrollar una infraestructura sólida que le permita desde su vivienda tener  exhibidores y contratar personas a las que pueda pagar un salario que beneficie a su familia.
Uno de los retos que ha enfrentado fue cuando se presentaron problemas de salud en su familia y  se quedó sin capital teniendo que empezar nuevamente;  Patricia H. es una excelente miembro de familia, conciente de sus obligaciones morales y con una gran capacidad de riesgo calculado que hacen de ella una mujer con una enorme proyección futura.
texts.en:
In the July 20th neighborhood tenement, there is a place near the Metropolitan Stadium in Barranquilla where soccer games are played and the neighbors are happy and supportive of one another. This place is the neighborhood where Patricia H. A. lives. She is 32 years old and has enjoyed being independent from a young age. Patricia started a home business making popsicles and frozen drinks packed in plastic bags. Her products are prepared naturally and consist of the most delicious tropical fruits of the region including guava, mango, soursop, coconut, banana, and pineapple. By serving these refreshments, Patricia became known in the community and gradually attracted business before she was presented with an opportunity to start selling general merchandise through specialized guides. She eventually started her new retail business in which she visited customers to demonstrate the products shown in the catalog prior to taking their orders. Patricia delivers the goods to the homes of her customers and started offering credit payment plans that require an initial down payment. At the moment, her only source of capital for this second business comes from selling popsicles. However, she was always short of the funds needed to fulfill her customers’ orders. It was at this point that Ana, a friend and neighbor, took note of her entrepreneurship and suggested that she visit Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a loan. Since then, she has continued to participate in the programs offered by the organization. The additional capital issued to Patricia has improved both the quantity and quality of her product offerings.

Patricia’s husband is a policeman and they have two dependent children. Her sister-in-law is a teacher and helps find customers among her friends at work who are more likely to pay. Patricia also sells shoes, silver plated ornaments, imitation gold, and appliances that are not offered in her product catalog but requested by her customers. For this reason, her customers prefer to buy from her, which has led to an expansion of her business since Patricia is willing to sell them whatever they need. Her current goal is to obtain a loan of 2,000,000 COP to buy silver and gold ornaments since these items are the most profitable.

For Patricia, having a business means establishing her status as an independent woman. With her earnings, she is able to pay Social Security so that she can support her parents and still maintain a beautiful and orderly home. This is a by-product of the willingness of her and her husband to live a better life each day. They have been able to make optimal improvements to their home by adding floors, doors, and closets. Patricia loves her husband because he does not limit her ability to dream or make investment decisions. He acknowledges that her choices have resulted in successful outcomes.

Patricia H. is a multifaceted woman. She enjoys her work, but she also participates in activities that support the feeding of the poor and encourage improving the nutritional levels of children who do not have enough to eat. Patricia lends a hand to an organization near her home that identifies mothers and guardians of children at risk and teaches them about proper nutrition. She has participated in programs that plant gardens in the yards of families with special needs. The revenue generated from this program goes to fund programs that strengthen family development. Her dream is to provide specialized training to educators and other professionals who work with children. As for her business, she wants to develop a solid program in which exhibitors can sell from their home and then hire employees and pay them a wage that will allow them to support their families. One of the challenges she faces is the existence of health problems in her family. She ran out of capital and is now having to rebuild. Patricia is an integral member of her family who is aware of her moral obligations. She has a great capacity for taking calculated risks necessary to map out her future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold and silver plated ornaments requested by her customers

loans.name: Pablo Absalon

texts.es: El señor Pablo es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de tres hijos mayores, tiene 63 años de edad, casado, su compañera es costurera y juntos se ayudan, para poder cubrir los gastos. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación en el barrio Villa Reconciliación. El inicio este negocio con venta de atoles, arroz en leche, cereales, golosinas, el cual comenzó ambulante en un carretón en donde día a día, vende por las calles, su variada de productos, el cual gracias a estos financiamientos logro comprar esta carreta y esta contento por que ha logrado crecer en su negocio. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, carnes, pollos  golosinas, ase, jabón, lácteos. Para mejorar las ventas. Su esposa le ayuda cuando el anda en su carreta vendiendo ambulante ya que tienes sus clientes que le compran y mueve más su dinero. Es cansado pero tiene que vender para cubrir sus necesidades de alimentos como pagos básicos de agua, luz, y el abono del préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo is a hard-working man. He is 63 years old married father of three grown children. His wife is a seamstress, and they work to help each other and cover household costs. He has a small grocery store, which he runs from his home in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He began his business selling a warm corn drink, rice with milk, cereal, and sweets from a traveling cart. Every day, he would sell his variety of products on the streets. Thanks to the loans he received he was able to buy his own cart, and he is happy because it has allowed him to grow his business. With this loan Mr. Pablo will buy basic grains, meats, chicken, soft drinks, roast, soap, and dairy products to increase his sales. His wife helps him when he walks with his cart selling in the streets since he already has his customers and money moves more quickly. It is tiring work, but he has to sell to cover his family's basic needs like paying for water, light, and loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic grains, meats, chicken, soft drinks, roast, soap, and dairy products

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Vichayal del distrito de Tuman, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad de Tuman desde hace diez años, todos los dias se dirige a este lugar para ofrecerle a sus clientes yucas, choclos, cebollas, papas y todo tipo de tubérculos y legumbres. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola en la empresa agroindustrial de la zona y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos familiares.

Doris nos comenta que gracias a este negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, que ahora ya son independientes. Su negocio goza siempre de buena acogida ya que siempre trata de vender productos frecos y de ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Doris desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es poder vivir en la ciudad para no tener que movilizarse todos los dias del mercado a su vivienda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doris is 41 and is married with children. She lives with her husband in the rural community of Vichayal, located in the District of Tuman, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Doris has run a vegetable stand in the Tuman city market for the last ten years. Every day she goes to work, offering her customers cassava [yuca root], corn, onions, potatoes, and all sorts of legumes and root vegetables. This enterprise is a great help to her family's finances because her husband is a field worker for the local agrobusiness company and his income is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. Doris has told us that thanks to her business she has been able to help her two children get ahead in life. Both are now grown and living independently. Her sales are good because she always tries to sell fresh products and offer her customers a good deal. Doris would like to expand her business by purchasing more goods to sell. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa [a Kiva Field Partner] for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles to help her meet her goal. Her greatest wish is to be able to live in the city so that she doesn't have to make the long trip each day back and forth from her home to the market. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa before and has been responsible and on-time with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina T. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jover's Group

texts.en: Jover T.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He is 30 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin. Jover has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Jover joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jover has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jover is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of his children. Jover is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Blessed Family Group

texts.en:
Esther W. is the head of a group of five borrowers called The Blessed Family. Esther is 48 years old. She did not go to school due to financial constraints.  She is single and has eight children whose ages range from 8 to 30 years old. Her first child did not go to school, but the rest of the children are attending school.

Esther is involved with the sale of used clothes, including socks and neckties. She has been in this business for 20 years. She started her business with 2,500 Liberian dollars and now has a working capital of 40,500 Liberian dollars. Her business is located on Randall Street, in downtown Monrovia.

She says many customers get attracted to her business because she sells quality goods and approaches customers in a good manner. She hopes to increase her business by using her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes.

 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther W. is holding the sign.

 

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia 's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

 

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Lubele North Laker Lucy Group

texts.en: L. Lucy is a hardworking business lady who is 27 years old. She is a married lady with three children. Two of the children are schooling. She also has dependents and one of them is schooling. She deals in the charcoal business and she has been operating this business for a period of two months. She is using the loan to purchase charcoal to sell in Pader. Her future hope is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kheoun Eim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 21 people who live in Angk Khlaeu village in Kandal province. The loan members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so they can improve their businesses in the future.

Mrs. Kheoun E. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, whilst another is a laborer, another is a security guard, and the other is attending the local public school. Mrs. Kheoun E.'s problem is that her house is too old to live in, so to improve the living conditions of her family, she is asking for a loan to fix her old house.

All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To fix her old house to improve the living conditions of her family

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en: Nhi T. N. was born in 1976. She is married with three childen who are going to school (two daughters and a son). She is a worker (she makes shoes). Besides that, she raises pigs. Her husband works in Da Hoi. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2003. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in livestock.

loans.use: to invest in livestock

loans.name: El Jardin Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA EL JARDIN ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD D. MARCELINO RODRIGUEZ, AXOCHIAPAN, ESTADO D. MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN POR SER VECINOS Y COMERCIANTES.
EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA BIBIANA H. H. TIENE 40 AÑOS, ESTUDIO LA SECUNDARIA TERMINADA, TIENE 4 HIJOS, 2 HOMBRES Y 2 MUJERES, ISAIAS TIENE 16 AÑOS, ELIEL 18 AÑOS, JUDITH 20 AÑOS Y GABRIELA 24 AÑOS, ELLA SE DEDICA DESD. HACE 10 AÑOS A LA VENTA D. COMIDA COMO SON TACOS D. ARROZ, SOPES, HAMBURGESAS, HOT DOG, ETC. 
BIBIANA DECIDIO INICIAR EL NEGOCIO EN SU DOMILICIO POR LAS NECESIDADES QUE TENÍA SU FAMILIA, PIUES CON LOS QUE SU ESPOSO GANABA NO LE ALCANZABA Y SUS HIJOS ESTUDIANDO.
AHORA ELLA SOLICITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR CARNE, ACEITE, REFRESCOS, SERVILLETAS Y RECAUDO EN GENERAL.
BINIANA NOS COMENTA "ACTUALMENTE ATIENDO A MAS D. 50 CLIENTES Y MI GRAN SATISFACCION ES QUE LOS CLIENTES ME DICEN QUE MI COMIDA ESTA SABROSA" Y CON ÉSTO ELLA TIENE GANANCIAS LAS CUALES UTILIZA EN SU HOGAR Y TAMBIEN LAS VUELVE A IVERTIR EN LOS INSUMOS PARA SEGUIR EN LA VENTA.
"EN MI COMINIDAD MARCELINO RODRIGUEZ, EL CLIMA ES MUY CALIENTE HAY UNA HACIENDA MUY BONITA Y EL RIO QUE PASA A LA MITAD DEL PUEBLO DEBERÍAN VISITAR ÉSTE LUGAR SEGURO SE LA PASARÁN BIEN Y TODAS NOSOTRAS ESTAMOS AGRADECIDAS CON EL APOYO QUE FRAC NOS HA BRINDADO Y QUE AHORA NOS BRINDA KIVA" NOS DICE BIBIANA 
LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON BIBIANA H. H. SE SEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, REINA M. D. J., COMPRA D. HUERTA D. ELOTES PAR VENDERLO POR BULTO, MARCELA M. P., COMPRA D. ACEITE, AZUCAR, SAL, SOPAS, REFRESCOS, PAPEL HIGIENICO ETC. PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA, MARIA FELIX M. F., VENTA POR CATALOGO, ANA LUISA D. A., VENTA POR CATALO, GREGORIO H. G. VA A SUTIR SU CARNICERIA
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Jardin" is located in the town of Marcelino Rodriguez in the municipality of Axochiapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico. This group is maD. up of 6 members who know each other because they are neighbors and area merchants. Bibiana H. is the representative of the group. She is 40 years old, and finished her secondary education. She has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls, they are: Isaias, 16, Eliel, 18, Judith, 20, and Gabriela, 24. For 10 years she has been selling food such as rice tacos, sopes, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc. Bibiana decided to start her business in her home so that she could meet the needs of her family, as her husband's earnings did not cover all the expenses and her children were in school. Now she requests a loan to buy meat, cooking oil, soft drinks, napkins and seasonings. Bibiana tells us that "currently, I attend to more than 50 customers and my greatest satisfaction is that my customers tell me that my food is delicious." With this business she has earnings that she can use for her personal expenses, and she can also use part of the earnings to invest in more supplies to continue the business. Bibiana tells us that, "In my community of Marcelino Rodriguez, the climate is very hot and there is a very pretty plantation and a river that passes through the middle of the town. You should visit this safe place, I know that you will enjoy it. All of us are very grateful for the support that you have provided us, and that now is being provided through Kiva." The members of the group are Bibiana H. H., who sells food, Reina M. D. J., who buys ears of corn from farms and sells them in bulk, Marcela M. P., who will buy cooking oil, sugar, salt, soups, soft drinks, toilet paper, etc. to restock her store, Maria Felix F., who sells through catalogs, Ana Luisa D. A., who sells through a catalog, and Gregorio H. G., who will restock his butcher's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil, napkins, soft drinks, tortillas and seasonings

loans.name: Sara Pastoriza

texts.es:
Sara Pastoriza L. V. tiene 53 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos, 2 que son casados, 2 solteros, 2 en colegio y un pequeño.

Sara es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Sara trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada, habas y arbejas. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar papas: comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y pagar gente para ayudarla. Su sueño es tener un terreno y dar estudios a sus hijos. Enfrenta enfermedades en la familia (su esposo).

Sus 2 hijos que están en el colegio trabajan con ella por la tarde (cuando no están al colegio).
texts.en:
Sara Pastoriza L. V. is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Guaranda area of Bolívar province. She has 7 children: 2 are married, 2 are grown up but still single, 2 are in high school, and the youngest is a little boy. Sara is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank, which is located half an hour from Guaranda. There are 16 members in total, most of whom work growing potatoes and maize. This is the first loan they have taken with the [field partner] San José Co-operative. Sara works in agriculture, growing potatoes, wheat, barley, beans and peas. She sells them, and buys what she needs, in Guaranda. She is seeking the loan to plant potatoes: to buy the seed potatoes, fertilizers and manure, and to pay people to help her. Her dream is to have her own land and to pay for her children's studies. She is also concerned about her husband, who is battling illness. Her 2 children who are at high school help her at work after school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes and fertilizers, and to pay people to help grow potatoes

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Khadidiatou M. est une yoffoise  de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 11 et 25 ans.
C’est la recherche de gains financiers  qui a poussé madame M. à épouser l’activité de commerce. Depuis plus de 6 ans elle évolue  dans la vente de  chaussures,  de tissus et d’autres marchandises diverses. 
Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis octobre 2009. L’argent qu’elle emprunte (200 000 frs) sera destiné à l’achat de chaussures et tissus pour la fête  de Korite qui est approximativement prévue au  debout  du  mois de septembre a Dakar.
Les bénéfices  réalisés  lui permettront d’assister son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de leurs enfants dans le souci d’améliorer  leur cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou M. is a 42 year old woman from Yoff. She is married and the mother of five children ranging in age from 11 to 25 years old. It was the search for financial gains that caused Mrs. M. to take on the job of running a store. For more than 6 years, she has increased her sale of shoes, fabrics and various other products. She has been a member of the Yoff fund since October 2009. The money she is borrowing (200,000 frs) will be put towards purchasing shoes and clothes for the festival of Korite which is expected to take place at the beginning of the month of September in Dakar. The profits she makes will allow her to help her husband to take care of the needs of their children in an effort to improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Funds

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Benito Soliven. She is 30 years old. Mercy is married and has two young children. To make a living, Mercy raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it. In 2009, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the second loan taken out by Mercy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria L. lives in  F. Roska, Brgy. Talisay, Sta. Fe, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  shell craft making and pig fattening businesses. Her common-law husband, who is 32 years old, works as a pedicab driver to earn his living.  She has 4 children who are between 1 month and  15 years old. 

Desideria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Desideria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and for tuition fees and additional capital. Desideria L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honourable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Alexis Jose

texts.es:
Alexis José hace 4 años y tiene 1 hijo, su esposa se dedica al hogar.
El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es un vendedor ambulante, vende ropa y cosméticos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 hasta las 8 de la noche. Es algo cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar materia prima pues así podrá satisfacer la demanda. Su sueño es tener un local comercial para vender en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
Alexis José has one son and his wife is a housewife. He considers himself to be a fighter, since the business that he dedicates himself to is very tough, but it allows him to make a living. Alexis José is a traveling salesman. He sells clothing and cosmetics. He works every day from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. This is a tiring job, but he has to work for the well-being of his family. He will use this credit to buy raw materials for his business so that he can meet the demand of his clients. His dream is to have a store so that he can sell his products from a fixed location.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Mary Waithira

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years and married to 40-year-old farmer Patrick Waweru. They have two children aged 10 and 12. Mary's business is situated at Githunguri in Kiambu, a place known for the highest milk production in Kenya. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last six years and earns a profit of 9,000 KES. 

Mary has no history with any other micro finance institution. She is applying for her first loan with Kiva partner, KADET, which she plans to use to buy another cow so that she can supply enough milk to meet the demands of her customers. She will plow her anticipated income back into her business. Mary plans to grow her farming business to be able to produce over 100 liters of milk daily. She is a very trustworthy and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 51 years old, widowed and has 11 adult-aged children. Trinidad owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily dried goods, in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 6 years. Her farm produces milk and eggs which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in farming has been disease, which affects her dairy cows.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire another asset that will generate income through the sale of milk. The income from this loan will help her improve the livelihood of her family. In future, she would like to acquire 4 more dairy cows, a posho mill and a chuff-cutter that will enable her to expand her farming.

Alice is 35 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children who attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Felix tiene 63 años de edad es casado  tiene 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, El y su familia viven en la calle Francisco pizarro Distrito de Parcona, en casa de material noble de un piso recien construido aun no esta con acabados.El se dedica como panificador y a la vez cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa el cual es apoyado por su esposa, ellos cuenta con el negocio hace 6 años. Cuentan con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder terminar de construir su casa. Con el dinero que solicita invertira para realizar algunos acabados de su vivienda.
texts.en: Felix is 63 years old, married and has 5 grown children.  He and his family live on Francisco Pizarro Street in the Parcona district in a one-story house made of solid materials.  This house was recently built and lacks finishing touches.  He is a baker, and at the same time has a small store in his house and his wife supports him in these activities.  They have had this business for 6 years.  One of their goals is to finish the construction on their house.  He will invest the money requested to finish the construction on his house.

loans.use: to do some finishing work on the construction of his house

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a mother from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Fareeda has two daughters and two sons, and the sons are already working and responsible for their families. The two daughters, Mai and Asma, are college students.

Fareeda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. A couple of years ago he started a small grocery store to increase the family's income and to be able to cover his daughters' education expenses.

Fareeda came to FATEN and took a loan because her husband wants to enlarge the store and sell a larger variety of products in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

Fareeda's son Salama appear in the picture here as she is a conservative woman like most inhabitants of Gaza.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase grocery store goods to sell

loans.name: Olparari Ole

texts.en:
Olparari Ole M. is 38 years old. He is married to Kiteleki Mukenye and the father of two school-aged children. 

Olparari is a businessman who has bought and sold young bulls for the past six years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he plans to use to purchase young bulls for fattening and resale. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent land for farming.
 
His dream is to become a commercial businessman and succeed in agriculture.

Despite his age, Olparari believes he is hard-working and will achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gunel

texts.ru:
Gunel R. 24 qoda. Ona ne zamujem. Gunel yavlyayetsya IDP personom i ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Gunel uje pochti dva qoda rabotayet uchitelniccey. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kompyuter dlya toqo chtobi uchit detey.
texts.en:
Gunel R. is 24 years old. She in not married. Gunel is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family. 

Gunel has been working as a teacher for almost two years. She now needs 2000 AZN to buy a computer to help her teach children at school.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Kolaban  (Let's Be Decisive) Group

texts.fr:
Kolaban est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Dar Salam  de la ville de  Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les parures, les céréales et les produits cosmétiques. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent  a été bien remboursé. Korotoumou K. est un des membres du groupe Kolaban qui vend le bois de chauffe et des parures (colliers, boucle d’oreille, bracelets et autres).  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs. Elle se procure  du bois dans les différents coins de brousse Sirakele, Kle  et Karaba. Son stock de bois est important. Quant aux colliers, ils sont achetés au marché avec les grossistes.  Elle vend le bois en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes. Les parures sont vendues en détail à la maison et partout où elle passe. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Kolaban comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Korotoumou K.  compte réaliser 120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kolaban is the name of a group of women who live in the quarter of Dar Salam, in the city of Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are 37 years old on average, they are married, and they have at least 5 children each. 

This group of women is involved in the sale of various items, such as firewood, clothing, and jewelry, cereal grains, and cosmetics. 

In order to increase their business the members of the group came together last year to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan, following the successful repayment of their first loan.  

Korotoumou Keita is one of the members of the Kolaban group and she sells firewood and jewelry (necklaces, earrings, bracelets etc.) She plans on using her loan to purchase loads of firewood from local producers. She purchases firewood from the various brush locales in Sirakele, Kle, and Karaba. Her inventory of wood is important. She purchases her products in the market from the wholesalers. She sells firewood in cash and credit from her home, to a clientele exclusively made up of women. She sells her jewelry on credit from her home and wherever she goes. 

The members of the Kolaban group expect to make an average monthly income of 110 000 FCFA through the span of this loan cycle. Korotoumou Keita expects to earn 1200 000 FCFA. 

Aside from repayment of their loan, they will use a part of their income to meet their family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and jewelry.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel G. is from the village of Mangga. He is 35 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joel has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria Suárez V. y su esposo cuentan con negocio de la venta de hamburguesas el cual tiene un año establecido. La venta la realiza los día Jueves, Viernes, Sábados y Domingos ya que son lo días qua mas se vende su producto. La pareja atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad  y limpieza pues este negocio es una fuente más de ingreso para el sostén familiar. El crédito que solicita es para comprar producto para elaboración de su venta.
texts.en: Victoria Suárez V. and her husband have a business selling hamburgers, which has been established for one year.  They sell their food on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, as these are the days when business is busiest.  The pair tends to their customers with friendliness and cleanliness, since this enterprise is what generates the income to support the family.  The loan they are requesting is for the purchase of the necessary ingredients to make the food they sell.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Jaoquin

texts.es:
Joaquín, de 60 años de edad, nació en Rodeo una comarca localizada en Pueblo Nuevo a 13 kilometros del Municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene 7 hijos, de oficio agricultor en el cual lleva alrededor de 46 años en esta actividad. Inicio a os 12 años de edad a trabajar en la agricultura, ayudando a su padre debido a su pobreza y la necesidad de buscar el alimento no logro estudiar. A los 26 años se independizo y compro una manzana de tierra con el dinero que gano trabajando en el campo.
Actualmente se  dedica a sembrar maíz y frijoles los cuales siembra en invierno y verano, ya que su terreno cuenta con un pozo para riego.
Solicita el crédito para comprar  2 quintales de UREA, 1	quintal de abono completo y pago de mano de obra. El crédito le ayudara a obtener una buena cosecha de maíz.
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta siempre segur cultivando sus tierras, tiene como meta próxima comprar otra manzana de tierra , comprar un par de bueyes para no tener que pagar para preparar la tierra y dejarles un techo digno donde sus hijos puedan  vivir y salir adelante en sus estudios ya que el no pudo.
texts.en:
Joaquin, 60 years old, was born in Rodeo, a community located in Pueblo Nuevo, 13 kilometers from the municipality of Esteli. He is married, the father of 7 children, and he is an agriculturist by trade, an occupation he has had for about 46 years. He started working in agriculture when he was 12 years old, to help his father who was poor and to secure nutrition.  He didn't go to school. When he was 26 years old he became independent and purchased a plot of land with the money he earned working the fields.

Today he cultivates corn and beans, sowing in the winter and the summer because his fields have a source of water. 

He requests a loan to purchase 2 packages of urea, 1 package of complete fertilizer, and to cover labor costs. The loan will help him secure a good corn harvest. 

Among his plans for the future is to keep cultivating the land. His next goal is to purchase another plot of land and to purchase 2 bulls to avoid paying to have the land tilled. His goal is to provide his children with a dignified home for them to live and to support them in their studies, something he was not able to do.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store in the province of Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Anita is borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she could increase her working capital and be able to buy more merchandise to sell in her sari-sari (general) store and therefore increase her income capacity. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in the general store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn M. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City. She is 20 years old. Arlyn is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase motor accessories and a raincoat for better services. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories and a raincoat for better services.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah F. is 34 years old, a mother of five children, and lives in the town of West Point. Her three boys and two girls’ ages range from 4-18 years. She’s engaged in selling palm oil: she buys it in the rural area and sells it in the local market in her community.

Tawah has requested a loan to purchase more palm oil, and hopes to make more profit to enable her to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Leah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Leah has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 42 years old, married to Henry Waweru, and they have five children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Leah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old, married with 4 children.  She sells garments for women and children.  Her business is open from 8am until 8pm every day except on Saturday, and she has 7 year's experience running it. 

Mediatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a variety of women's and children's garments for sale . With any profit, Mediatrice will reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of women's and children's garments for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a producer of gari (a fried dish made from cassava) at Abura near Brasi. She has a child she is taking care of. Adjoa will use this loan to purchase more cassava to make more gari for sale. She plans to build a storehouse with her new profits and to further invest in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to cook more gari for sale.

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 6 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of her group Ayudanos Señor 6 (Help Us Lord 6). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where it is common to see sugar cane fields around the communities. Sandra makes her home in a simple structure where she lives with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a very hardworking woman who is committed to her plans to change her family’s life and provide better living conditions, a better house, and a good education for her children. 

Sandra is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She runs a small business stand in her house and she will use her loan to purchase shoes, clothes, cosmetics, and accessories to sell. She plans to re-invest her profits into her business.

Sandra’s long-term goal is to improve her house and business with good savings and a stable source of income. With this loan and the blessing of God, she is very sure to do this.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, cosmetics, and accessories to sell

loans.name: Eangsim

texts.en:
Eangsim, age 43, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Eangsim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a hand tractor to help plow the rice field. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Richard David

texts.es:
Richard David tiene 20 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Richard se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz en terrenos propios, además se dedica a la comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar una camioneta.

Le gusta estar con la familia, hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Richard David is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. He does not have any children.

The members of the "Sagrado Corazón" ("Sacred Heart") communal bank can be found located in the Cuatro Esquinas ("Four Corners") sector in the canton of Guaranda, some 15 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This communal bank has 12 members who work in agriculture, animal husbandry and sales, and other income-producing activities.

Richard works in agriculture. He plants potatoes, wheat, and corn on his own land, and also sells vegetables. He makes his purchases in the market in Guaranda and sells his goods in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his crops. The support from this loan will help him to meet his needs. He faces challenges like crop illnesses. His dream is to buy a pickup truck.

He likes spending time with his family, playing sports, and dancing at parties and festivals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang and her husband, pictured here, live along National Road Number Five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and one daughter. Lang sells lotus and fish that her husband catches and supplements her earnings with a new pig-raising business. Her husband is a fisherman. One of the couple’s children is a garment worker, one is a construction worker, another child assists his father in the fishing business, and the other two are in school.

Lang is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to purchase a motorcycle so that her son, who is a construction worker, can commute to work. This will be her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike so that her son can commute to work

loans.name: Nhin

texts.en: From one day to the next, Nhin thinks about ways to create lots of money for her family. She is a farmer and also raises pigs. As for her husband, he is also a farmer. Both of them try hard to find the income to support the family as comfortably as others. Nhin has more farms to plant. To meet the family's need to have a good standard of living, Nhin wishes to borrow $1,000 to purchase a veranda column and planks for repairing her old house.

loans.use: To purchase a veranda column and planks for repairing her old house.

loans.name: Merlibeth

texts.en:
Merlibeth is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Merlibeth has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and snacks.
Merlibeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and snacks

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 33-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and only child. He has been working in the construction field from more than 18 years and he specializes in completing wall foliage work. He began his career at a very young age. Later on, he started to take on his own projects. 

Working on a freelance basis, he managed houses in his village and its surroundings. With the requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase added tools and supplies since he intends to grow his business by sticking with projects for bigger houses.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Socorro Del Pilar

texts.es:
Socorro es madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en casa de su hermana, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años Socorro se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipollo, salchipapas y gaseosas por las noches diariamente, su negocio lo ha instalado en las afueras de la casa donde vive, cuenta con su infraestructura propia para que lleguen sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más insumos, sillas y mesas para que siga ampliando su negocio, para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y con esas ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Socorro trabaja con mucha dedicación para que poco a poco su familia se supere y logre sus metas.
texts.en:
Socorro is a thirty-two year old mother. She lives with her children in her sister's house, which only has electricity service, located in the rural district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. This area is known for farming, livestock and crafts.

For some years Socorro has worked preparing and selling fried potatoes with chicken and fried potatoes with hot dogs, daily every night. She has a stall for her business outside her house where her customers come, and with the earnings she gets she can meet the day-to-day necessities of her family.

She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles ($375.00) in order to buy more supplies, chairs and tables in order to continue expanding her business, in order to meet the needs of her customers. With those profits she can pay her loan and better her quality of life. Socorro works hard so that step by step her family will overcome and achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, chairs and tables in order to expand her business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and rent bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and earn more profits.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 21 years old.  She is a single woman with no children.  She has a business selling breads in Dar es Salaam in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years. She also earns some income from selling vegetables.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.  She will use the profit to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy breads to sell

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор женат и ответственный отец двое сыновья. Его жена домохозяйка. Он занимается купля продажей DVD дисков на рынке. У него много постоянные клиенты. Абдусаттор хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и поэтому старается максимизировать свою прибыль. Абдусаттор хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2500$ США. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Abdusattor is married and is a responsible father of two sons.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in buying and selling DVD disks at the market.  He has many loyal customers.  Abdusattor wants to provide a good quality of life for his family and, thus, tries to maximize his profit.  Abdusattor wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan in the sum of $2500 to achieve this goal.  He thanks all of you in advance for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase DVD disks

loans.name: Eliseo Ramon

texts.es: Eliseo Ramón tiene 47 años, es casado y fruto de su unión tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 14 años de edad. Su actividad es la venta de granos básicos, Eliseo es un hombre muy entusiasta el disfruta obtener un medio de ingreso. El labora como empleado en el ingenio san Antonio fue con el paso del tiempo que empezó a implementar la venta de granos básicos con los mismos trabajadores. Eliseo se necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz, concentrado entre otros.
texts.en:
Eliseo Ramón is 47 years old, married, and has two children (ages 22 and 14). He has a business selling dry goods. Eliseo is an enthusiastic gentleman who enjoys what he does for a living. He is an employee at a refinery in San Antonio, but in his spare time he started selling dry goods with his co-workers.

Eliseo needs a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn, concentrated foods, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn, concentrated foods, and other products.

loans.name: Sohun

texts.en:
Sohun is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her oldest son is 7 years old and he is in school, while her 4-year-old daughter is not in school yet. 

Sohun is a farmer. She started farming on her rice field nearly 5 years ago. She has also been making a living with planting sugarcane and she worked for others at a sugarcane plantation to generate additional income. 

She has been with VisionFund for 3 years. Sohun is requesting a third loan to cultivate her rice paddy and plant sugarcane. She hopes this loan will help her increase her crop yield and that the sugarcane trees will provide more income to feed her family, build some savings for the future and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice paddy and plant sugarcane trees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marizela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizela; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como secretaria y también es asesora de ventas de inmuebles, la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo como secretaria y asesora de ventas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un artefacto para su casa.      
                                       
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Marizela is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Tete Caca” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, single, and has one child. Marizela divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a secretary. She is also a real estate sales agent. Through these jobs, she is able to help her son move forward. Marizela wants to improve in her work as a secretary and as a sales agent. She is requesting a loan to buy an appliance for her home.

Marizela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for her home.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Savan, 27, is married and resides with her husband. Savan sells fish, and her husband is a construction worker. Mach is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish to expand her fish selling business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more incomes. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Ninoska Del Rosario

texts.es: Ninoska Del Rosario se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 4 años en su negocio, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Uno de los obstáculos que ha vencido es la inestabilidad del precio de sus productos. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, sabanas, cosméticos, camisas, pantalones, prendas entre otros productos. Ninoska quiere mejorar cada el servicio que brinda a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ninoska del Rosario sells general merchandise, a job she’s had for four years. She has two young children for whom she is responsible. One obstacle she’s overcome is the unpredictable prices of the products she sells. 

Ninoska needs a loan to buy footwear, sandals, cosmetics, shirts, pants and other clothing. She wishes to improve the service that she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy footwear, sandals, cosmetics, shirts, pants and other clothing

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a thirty-year-old, married woman with six children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this investment to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells kenkey (maize dumplings often used in soups) at Efutu. She has been selling kenkey for 20 years.  

Aba is a single parent with four children. As a single parent she uses her income to feed, cloth and pay the school fees of her children. 

Aba needs this loan to purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Aba wishes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Sulaimonkul

texts.ru: Сулаймонкул мужчина 43 лет, отец шестерых детей. Он имеет большой опыт в деятельности животноводства, поэтому много лет занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена домохозяйка, которая занимается семейными делами. Сулаймонкул хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов баранов и коз. Он искренне благодарен организации за качественное обслуживание, понимание и своевременное финансирование.
texts.en: Sulaimonkul is a 43 year-old man and a father of six children.
