He has extensive experience in the animal husbandry business and this is why he has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock for many years.  His wife is a homemaker, who is involved in household work.  Sulaimonkul wants to obtain this loan to purchase several heads of sheep and goats.  He is genuinely grateful to the organization for the quality service, understanding and timely financing.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 

Gloria has a hog-raising business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She  has a requested loan of 13,000 PHP to  purchase feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria hopes to have a meat shop in order to help her husband cover their daily needs and for the future of their five children, because Gloria wants their five children to finish their studies for their future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Fifamariaton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFAMARIATON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florentine Tchochou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florentine Tchochou est mariée a un certain Vincent dont on ignore la profession. Florentine Tchochou a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Florentine Tchochou Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Florentine Tchochou vend depuis quinze ans des outils de mercerie, des tissus, et des cartes de recharge. Florentine Tchochou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Florentine Tchochou ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFAMARIATON sollicite un cinquième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des cartes de recharges.

loans.name: Assiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Novembre 2015 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elle.

Madame Assiatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et  mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de paniers de poissons.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 03 paniers de 25 kg de poissons et payer un transport de 10000 pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de développer son épargne et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.

loans.use: acheter 03 paniers de 25 kg de poissons et payer un transport de 10000 pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

loans.name: Fana Mihkalova

texts.en: Fana owns and runs a small grocery in one of the Roma neighborhoods in Sliven, Bulgaria.  She has had this small store for 15 years, and has built up enough of a capital base to enable her to extend credit to many of her customers in difficult times.  However, she has found herself with a surprising expense – a new refrigerator. Her current cooler has started to leak badly, and has become prohibitively expensive to operate, increasingly so as the summer approaches.  Unplugging it is not an option – yogurt is a staple of the Bulgarian diet, accounting for a significant amount of her sales year-round, and in the summer, ice cream sales become a major revenue contributor.   Fana’s daughter and husband work for her.  Her daughter typically works in the store while her husband focuses on sourcing inventory from the lowest-cost provider in the region.   Lenders interested in learning more about the Roma culture in Bulgaria might find “Bury Me Standing: The Gypsies and Their Journey” by Isabel Fonseca to be helpful.  The book was published in 1995 and is widely available.

loans.use: New refrigerator

loans.name: Puna

texts.en: Puna is a thirty two year old unemployed woman, married with five children. Her husband like her is also unemployed, but doing fishing apart from his wife’s business for extra earning for their extended family. With their five children that they’re raising, they are also providing support for Puna’s father, brothers and sisters that are staying together with them. All of her relatives are working in her taro plantation (starchy rootcrop which serves as staple food in Samoa, like rice in Asia or potatoes in other countries) and helping out Puna with her business so that it will become their family business in the future. They’ve planted more than seven thousand taros, and will be harvesting one thousand taros every end of the month.

loans.use: Buy planting materials, organic fertilizers and  organic pesticides.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum V. sells fried corn at the local market in Phnom Penh.  She earns about $10/day in revenue, of which $3 is profit.  Her husband is a preacher, and her earn about $1.50/day.  Chum and her husband have 3 children that live with them--1 works for a private company and earns $70/month, 1 is a garment factory worker, and 1 helps with his mother's business.  With this loan, Chum V. will buy a motorbike for transportation to and from the market.  She also has plans to use the motorbike for delivering cakes that one of her friends bakes.  As she saves up money, she wants to slowly build up the land around her house to protect her family from floods during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for transportation to market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bike transport business

loans.name: Real

texts.en:
Mrs. Real Y. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her two pre-school-aged kids, while her other two are employed at a garment factory together, earning up to $180 a month. Additionally, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman earning $5 each day.

Mrs Real Y. will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work and buy construction tools.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband to go to work and construction tools.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Business Description

Verónica works washing and drying clothing. She has 6 years of experience and works in her business seven days a week. She serves the members of her community that come to her laundromat in order to meet her own needs, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to sustain her business.

Loan Use

Verónica is asking for a loan to buy more supplies like detergent and fabric softener, and also to decorate her laundromat, which is in her house, so that she can attend to her customers and make them comfortable. With the number of clientèle that she has accumulated, Verónica has to work hard to satisfy their requests and worries. She has been able to do this thanks to her experience in the business.

Personal Information

Verónica is 34 years old and works hard side by side with her husband to make her business a success. Thanks to her hard work they have been able to send their only son to school. Because of her consideration and sacrifice, she has been able to keep her family together and make her business stable. Verónica hopes to make her business successful and expand it much more so that she can increase her capital for the wellbeing of her child and her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Verónica se dedica a lo que es lavada y secada de prendas de vestir. Teniendo como experiencia 6 años, ya que su actividad lo realiza todos los días de las semanas. Sirviéndole a la comunidad del sector que acuden hacia el negocio de ella para librarse de cualquier apuro, y que gracias a su propio esfuerzo ha podido mantenerse en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Verónica solicita el crédito para comprar más insumos como detergentes y suavizantes, además esta decorando su local que se encuentra en su domicilio, para de esa manera atender a sus clientes de una manera cómoda y confortable. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Verónica se ve en la necesidad de complacer a sus clientes con sus peticiones e inquietudes, que gracias a la experiencia que tiene en su actividad ha podido satisfacerlos.

Información Personal

Dona Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, en donde junto a su esposo se esfuerzan día a día para salir adelante en esta actividad, además gracias al esfuerzo que realiza tienen a su único hijo estudiando. Con las atenciones y sacrificios que realizan, ha podido mantener su familia unida y su negocio estable. Los anhelos de Verónica es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de su hijo, en si de la familia.

loans.use: To decorate and buy supplies for her laundromat.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41 year old father of 3. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Saida. Ali is a carpenter. This is the third time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua, and he is a good client who is never late with the repayments. Ali needs a loan to buy the required wood for his carpentry work. You can see him in the picture, in his work environment, with one of Al Majmoua's loan analysts.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret B. wants a loan to buy more tables, chairs, and umbrellas for her bar. More than that, she wants to buy more equipment and more crates of beer for her bar. Margaret believe that her bar needs more glasses and more brands of beer.

With the loan, Margaret also wants to add lodging to her bar and expects to open up a depot of beer for supplying others.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: Expand her bar

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu Samura is married with one child. He is 28 years old and owns a shop in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. He sells basic groceries, such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil, wholesale. Abu’s business is now steady and established, and it increased as a result of previous loans.

An ambitious man, Abu would like to run a big business in town, so he can provide more for his family. But he cannot afford the loans from the formal financial system. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: Abu would like to further diversify and expand his grocery business so that he can provide better for his family.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Your support with the first loan helped me to move both my business and my family forward. My business has grown sufficiently thanks to God and to your support. The business space, however, needs some remodeling and a wider variety of products. I am requesting a loan of $700.00 USD in order to improve my business space and purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Por su apoyo en el primer crédito me ayudo mucho a sacar adelate el negocio y a mi familia. El negocio ha crecido lo suficiente gracias a Dios y a su apoyo. Al local le esta haciendo falta una remodelaciones y algo mas de variedad de productos. Solicito un préstamo de $700.00 Dlls. para acondicionar el negocio y la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and improvement of business space

loans.name: Sukarti

texts.id:
Sukarti is a trash collector that collects usable junks. She rents a room in Bedahulu road for $17 per month. With her cart Sukarti traverses housing and market alleys to collect used goods. She also purchases unusable junks from local housewives. Those junks are purchased by weight. Loan from DINARI will be used to purchase more junks from junkyard workers. She hopes to improve her family's financial situation in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sukarti adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobaknya Sukarti menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sukarti membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Purchase Used Items to be Resold/Recycled

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
This gentleman is a retailer in the busy neighborhood of Ziguinchor. He is asking for a short-term loan which he plans to repay in 10 months and will use to reinforce his little shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ce sociétaire est un détaillant dans un quatier populaire de Ziguinchor, il sollicite un crédit remboursable en 10 mois pour renforcer son commerce.

loans.use:
to reinforce his little business

pour renforcer son commerce

loans.name: Sabrinisso

texts.ru:
Sabrinisso S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She lives with her large family. She is married and has 5 children. She has secondary education and has worked in farming (government owned) since graduation. She also has her own livestock. She has 2 bulls, and she would like to increase that number. To do that, she needs to purchase a cow of good breed. That is the reason why she came to MLF HUMO. A loan will give her an opportunity to increase her livestock and obtain milk for the children. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Сабриниссо жительница города Вахдат. Живет со своей большой семьей. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее . Всю жизнь работает в колхозе . Так же имеет свое частное хозяйство. Имеет 2 бычков и хочет увеличить поголовье скота. Для этого необходимо купить корову отличной породы. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Это даст возможность увеличить хозяйство, получать молоко для детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the livestock

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. A., 35, is a grocer in the village. She sells groceries in front of her house and earns $5 each day. Her husband is a policeman in Phnom Penh. They have two children and they are students.
To meet her customers' demands, she would like a loan to help her purchase more stuffs. The leftovers will be used to raise animals to sell.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase groceries in bulk to resell and raise animals.

loans.name: Carlos Felipe

texts.es:
21-year old Carlos Felipe P. C. is single and lives in Caserío Tzanquieck in the village of Nimasac, located in the municipality and department of Totonicapán. For more than three years he has worked as a shoemaker; then six months ago he decided to start his own workshop. He is asking for a loan of Q.7,008.00 from the Asociación Asdir so that he can continue his work and meet the high demand that occurs during the months of December, January, February, and March of next year. This is Carlos’ second loan; he has shown responsibility in his monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos Felipe P. C. de 21 años de edad, solter con residencia en el Caserío Tzanquieck uleu, de la Aldea Nimasac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán quien por mas de 3 años viene ejerciendo su actividad como zapatero pero hace mas de 6 meses se sometió a crear su propio taller de zapatería y esta solicitando un crédito en la Asociación Asdir por la cantidad de Q. 7,008.00 para poder seguir trabajando en esta época, para poder cubrir la demanda en la época buena la cual es en los meses de diciembre, enero, febrero y marzo del próximo año, ya que es su segundo crédito que solicita en donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos mensuales.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials, tools, and machinery for his shoemaking business.

loans.name: Majeeda's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda baji is the wife of M. and the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. She lives in a small area of the of city Kasur, named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. Majeeda baji owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 19 years. Her elder son works in a factory. The next eldest to him is a daily wage laborer. Her husband sells crockery and has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Majeeda baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy more crockery to help expand her husband's business.

Majeeda baji is joined in her loan group by a four more members. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles, papers) for her scrap business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy a power loom machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy crockery

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeung P., 41, and her second husband, Mr. Chanthy Lau, 53, live along National Road Number 1, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993. Mrs Loeung has one son from her first husband, and her son studies in the local school.

Mrs. Loeung has been selling Chinese noodles and porridge since 2003. She cooks the food herself and sells it early in the morning in front of her house. Her husband has been a driving instructor for three years.

Loeung is requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a rest room in her family's home.

loans.use: To build one rest room to use in her family.

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Lastenia, socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños en un pequeño taller ubicado en su propia en el Jr. Los Laureles Mz. E – Lt. 9. Trabaja sobre la base de pedidos y sus clientes son  amigos, familiares y personas que llegan gracias a la recomendación de sus clientes ya conocidos.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará una máquina recubridora para implementar su taller, también comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diferentes variedades y colores, elásticos, blondas y otras materiales que necesita  para realizar sus trabajos de confección, porque también confecciona y vende.

Lastenia tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo en vista de que sus hijos ya son independientes. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora. Su meta es seguir creciendo y contar con un taller de costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lastenia, a member of the group "Manos Unidos" ( United Hands), lives in the Region and Province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She has been making a wide variety of men's, women's, and children's clothes in her small workshop located in her own home. She works on commission and her clients are often her friends, family and people who come to her on recommendation.

The loan of $500 will be repaid in 6 months and she will use it to buy a sewing machine to use in her workshop. She will also buy many different colored threads, fabrics and elastic bands along with other materials she needs to assemble her clothes.

Lastenia is 55 years old and she lives with her husband and all their children are now independent adults. She is a hard working and optimistic person. Her goal is to continue to see her business grow and to see her workshop well equipped.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, threads, fabrics and elastic bands

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42 year old Joyce N. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of nine and 21 years old. Joyce has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Joyce currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase material so she can create clothing (her specialty is women’s clothing) to sell them to her customers. Joyce thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase material for making clothing

loans.name: Totosa Group

texts.en:
Astride M. is 38 years old and a mother of four children. She began her business in 1998 selling doughnuts and spices. Her business prospered until 2006 when a car accidentally drove over her stand and destroyed all of her goods. Astride used to sell on a stand along the main road in her popular area of Eastern Kinshasa. Having no financial resources to restart her business, Astride was out of business for two years.

She resumed the business in February 2008 and joined Totosa, one of Hope’s groups last May. With the coming loan, Astride is planning to purchase another sack of wheat flour and to rent a location for her business in a place where she can avoid another car accident, heavy rains and the strong sun. She is also planning to diversify her business by adding an outdoor section to sell beverages.

loans.use: To purchase another sack of wheat flour and rent a location for her business

loans.name: Ismelda Edita

texts.es:
La señora Ismelda Edita L. Venegas tiene 48 años,  pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive  en la Avenida La Marina Mz 1 lote 18 Aurora Díaz I del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando por motivos económicos, pero se capacitó como cosmetóloga. Se casó de 25 años y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 son estudiantes.
Tiene un pequeño salón de belleza  que funciona en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró insumos para su salón.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en productos para su negocio como, navajas, champú, tintes.
Ismelda sueña con tener un salón muy grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ismelda Edita L. Venegas is 48 years old and belongs to the Community Bank "Las Emprendedoras II" (The Enterprising Women II). She lives on La Marina Mz 1 Avenue, Lot 18, Aurora Diaz 1 of the Salaverry Port in the province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through her second year of middle school but did not continue studying due to economic reasons. However, she trained herself as a cosmetologist. She was married at 25 and has 6 children, 5 of whom are students. She has a small beauty salon that she runs out of her home. With her first loan credit of 300 soles, paid in 4 payments, she bought supplies for her salon. With this loan of 500 soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, she will invest in products for her business, such as razors, shampoo and hair dye. Ismelda dreams of having a large salon.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business such as razors, shampoo and hair dye

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is the 43-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are attending elementary school in Abofour, a town in the Ashanti region where they live. Abena has been selling food items such as maize for over six years, having begun the business when demand for cereals became very high. Purchasing her goods from the farmers in her town, she markets them both locally and in the surrounding communities.

Abena is requesting a loan to increase her working capital in order to buy in bulk, a measure that will expand both her customer base and her profit margin, her goal being to save more money to better assist her husband in meeting their children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as maize in bulk.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, who is married and has a grown child, started working as a market vendor five years ago and today runs her own business selling food items in the “Covered” city market in Belaya Tserkov. Presently, Lina has about 15,000 Grivnas of working capital and her monthly profit amounts to 4,700 Grivnas. 

Purchasing prices rose after the economic crisis reached the Ukraine, so Lina needed loans to maintain her inventory. She has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity, having repaid every loan received from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. This time Lina is seeking to borrow 5,000 Grivnas to purchase dried fruit wholesale.  An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Flavio Julio

texts.es: Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.
texts.en:
Flavio Julio is a small scale farmer who has dedicated most of his life to growing modest amounts of rice. Because he has so much experience, he is quite productive. His family has six members and all of his children are grown. They help sow the rice, and Flavio's wife takes care of the home and dispatches him to work in the fields early every morning. Flavio has always dreamt of participating in the construction of a thresher that he could use on his fields and now, thanks to this loan, he will be able buy parts and do just that.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy thresher parts

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina es una madre amorosa y muy preocupada por el bienestar de su familia, vive en su propia casa, con sus 3 hijos; Omar de 22, Adolfo de 17 y Oliver de 14, a los cuales quiere dar una buena educación. Dina divide su tiempo entre dos negocios, tiene una tienda de abarrotes y unas cabinas de internet, ella trabaja desde que amanece, atendiendo a los clientes que concurren a su tienda muy temprano, a quienes siempre recibe con una sonrisa. A las 9 de la mañana abre su otro negocio, las cabinas de internet, esta actividad es muy rentable, debido a la gran demanda que hay por el servicio de Internet. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es atender los dos negocios a la vez, por eso cada vez que pueden sus hijos la ayudan a atender sus cabinas. Lleva 5 años realizando ambas actividades y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, anhela hacer crecer sus dos negocios y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Dina con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual, ya que ahorró mucho para pagarlo, en su banco comunal es una socia  muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Dina is a loving mother who is very worried about the wellbeing of her family. She lives in her own home with her three children: Omar, 22; Adolfo, 17; and Oliver 14, all of whom she wants to have a good education. Dina divides her times between two businesses. She has a grocery store and Internet cubicles. She works from sunrise, tending to customers who come to her store very early and always receive a smile. At 9 in the morning she opens her other business, Internet cubicles, which is a very lucrative business thank to the high demand there is for Internet service. The most difficult thing is tending to the two businesses at the same time, so her children help her out with the Internet cubicles anytime they can. She has done both activities for five years, and the thing she enjoys the most is talking with her customers and finding out about what's going on in the community. Her goal is to grow both businesses and thus grow economically as well. This is Dian's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she was very punctual with her first since she had already saved a lot to pay for it. She is a very happy and supportive member of her community bank. With the money she is requesting she will purchase more products to better set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans A. A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Evans sells spare car parts at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a trader. Evans uses his income to pay for utility bills, food, school fees, etc.

Evans will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of car spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. Evans plans to reinvest the new profits into his business to expand his trade.

loans.use: Capital for spare car parts business

loans.name: Mrs. Savoen Bol Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of twenty one members and is located in Dei Eth Koh Phos village in Kandal province. The group plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Savoen B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. Savoen B. is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is too yoU. to work or study. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well she has many customers who need new fashions, so she has decided to request a loan to purchase more clothes to resell and to support her customer's needs. Her husband, Mr. Nao Lach, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell and to support her customers

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome has been a bites seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to the Mwenge West loan group (code 2020). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $100. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil, to make different bites for resale. She hopes her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Salome is 33 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 7 and four. She also cares for four dependents.

loans.use: Buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ACCHA”, están situados en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente al valle sagrado de los inkas, ubicado a 1 hora desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, en su mayoría ellos elaboran la artesanía manualmente y llevan a cocerlos en los hornos industriales de algunos amigos, 2 socias se dedican ala venta de comidas y tortas en el paradero principal, los socios requieren el préstamo en razón de poder invertir en la compra de más insumos y hornos industriales para continuar con esta labor que llevan de generación en generación, en el caso de las otras socias ellas desean invertir en su hogar en algunos muebles.

Los socios se muestran muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the banking coop "Señor de Accha" live in the district of Pisac, which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, about one hour from Cusco. Our members make native food to sell while working at home. The majority of them make the food at home and then bring it to the commercial ovens of friends to be cooked. The principal job of two of the members is to sell the food and cakes at the main bus stop. In order to insure their business is sustained from generation to generation, the members would like a loan in order to buy more supplies and a commercial oven. Some of the women would like to invest in some furniture for their homes. The members are very appreciative of the money for the loan and they promise to pay all of the debts to which they have committed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in supplies in order to further develop business

loans.name: Tauese

texts.en:
Tauese P., 70, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~90 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tauese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and weedkiller

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
P. Hoàng Thị is a 45 year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, P. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. P. has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. P. is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her operation.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda L. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Raymunda is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Raymunda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Raymunda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Raymunda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raymunda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Raymunda is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Raymunda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora, tiene 51años y vive sola en un cuarto alquilado, donde también implementó su tienda de licores. Son 20 años los que han pasado desde que Ana dejó su querida Madre de Dios (departamento peruano límite con Brasil) y cuando llegó a la ciudad de Juliaca, se propuso salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo. Ahora cuenta con una tienda de licores, la cual le genera buenos ingresos, ya que es muy concurrida, debido a la alegría que le pone al momento de vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, lleva 16 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que despertarse a altas horas de la noche para atender a sus clientes, ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy buena. Espera con el tiempo tener el dinero necesario para tener una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el quinto préstamo de Ana con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos no ha tenido problemas con los pagos. Ella es la socia más alegre de su banco comunal y les transmite a todas esa alegría a sus compañeros. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más licores para implementar el stock de su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Khloak

texts.en: Khloak D., 30, is a married woman and mother. She retails both new and used clothes that she orders in bulk from wherever it is sold at a reasonable price. She is married to Koy Sarim, age 30, who is a motor taxi rider. They have two minor children. Khloak D. conducts her investment very smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who need to buy her clothes because she is skilled in public relations. To earn extra income and in order to satisfy more customers' needs, Khloak D. would like a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used to accumulate more clothing to continue retailing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita B. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Nita is married and has 4 school-aged children. Nita owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetable products in the local community. Nita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 37 years old and married to an accountant. She has 4 children: Mulhat, 16 years old; Sumeya-,13 years old; Khalid,10 years old and Imran, 7 years old. 

Jamila owns a salon and also sells beauty products. She has been doing this for 15 years. She also supplies clothes to boutiques. With the loan she has requested from KADET, she will use 20,000 KSH to purchase hair treatment chemicals, 20,000 KSH for a steaming machine and the remaining 40,000 KSH will be used to buy creams for skincare and facials.

Jamila was introduced to KADET by her friends who are existing members of the organization. Previously, she was working with Faulu. 

Jamila's salon is located in a neighborhood in Malindi town and her customers are residents of Malindi. Jamila aims to build her own business premises, with the additional revenue generated from this loan, rather than renting. Jamila's hopes and dreams are to own her own house, buy a car and to establish a successful business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase products for her business, a salon.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is a 65-year-old widow with five grown children. To make a living, Bernardita owns and operates a food stall in the local community where she sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $43 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernardita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for additional working capital. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Saodat owns a successful clothing sales business located at the “Korvon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 11 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Saodat tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Saodat has requested a loan of 4300 somoni to increase her inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors as the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Saodat will be better prepared to meet the increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase working capital for development of a clothing business

loans.name: Rosamonda

texts.en:
Rosamonda manages a rice farm. The income from her one-hectare rice field is enough to supply the needs of her family. She is married to Rayven and they have two children, the eldest being 11 years old. She wants her children to have a better future, and to be provided with a proper education. She works hard in order to achieve it.

She joined the Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to request a loan that will be helpful in financing her business. She requested 10,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies for the maintenance of her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GLADYS tiene 42 años, es casada, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene tres hijos. Sus hijos son: Toshy es independiente, Mayra estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional de ciencias políticas y Kevin estudia en el colegio.
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de artefactos. La socia viaja a la ciudad de Tacna y compra artefactos a pedido de sus clientes de los centros comercial de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más artefactos para vender en estas fiestas navideñas.             
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, GLADYS, is 42 years old, married, and a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the “RICCHARY CUSCO” cooperative bank of the Arariwa Association. This member has three children: Toshy, now independent; Mayra, who is studying political science at the university; and Kevin, who is still in school. She alternates between being a homemaker and selling artifacts. She travels to the city of Tacna and buys artifacts on special order for her customers in the commercial zone of the city of Cusco. She has had the business for several years, and things have gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work. Our member is a hard-working and enterprising woman, who helps her family get ahead. She requires a loan to augment her working capital, and she would like to buy more artifacts to sell over the Christmas holiday season. She is very grateful for the opportunities provided her via this medium, and likewise commits to making her loan payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital, and to purchase more artifacts to sell over the Christmas holiday season.

loans.name: Cristiam Anielka

texts.es: La Señora Cristiam Anielka tiene la edad de 30 años, es madre soltera y con  2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña ella es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que Doña Cristiam se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios comienzan por capital propio por lo que no contaba con los ingresos suficientes la. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar materia prima. Su deseo es establecer su negocio en su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristiam Anielka is 30 years and cares for her two children as a single mother. For more than 5 years, Cristiam has been selling clothing to earn a living. In the beginning, she used her own savings until she generated more income from sales. The loan will be used to purchase material to make the clothes. Cristiam's dream is to be able to set up a business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material for her clothing business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 46-year-old widow with six children, between the ages of eight and twenty years old. Four of the children are attending school. She's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for two years and previously worked as a milk vendor. She sells her milk to milk vendors in the local community. She also grows tea and earns some extra income from her crop. She says that the main challengers to her business are a lack of finances to expand the business and animal diseases, but these are mitigated by her dairy cow insurance.

She successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 30,000 and then requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, she would like to construct a modern dairy unity and produce over 20 litres of milk per cow each day.

Rosemary says that the loan will help her improve her income from dairy cows so that she can educate her children who are in school. Even being a widow, she says she can manage to pay school fees and meet other necessities through the income from the dairy cow she obtained through Juhudi Kilimo.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hermes Nicolas

texts.es:
Hermes tiene 50 años, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus seis hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una empresa exportadora de espárragos. Pero los ingresos no le bastan para solventar sus gastos familiares, por este motivo pudo, con mucho esfuerzo, instalar una bodega en su casa hace algunos años, en ella ofrece a sus clientes abarrotes y bebidas.

Por otro lado también tiene una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual se genera algunos ingresos extras y ayuda a sostener su familia. 

Hermes se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su bodega y en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, ya que esta ha sufrido algunos desperfectos.

El es un padre trabajador y bastante responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen bastante estima. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo como empresario para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hermes is 50 years old, is married and lives with his wife and 2 of his 6 children in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the región of La Libertad, located 3 hours of the city of Chiclayo.

He works as a chauffeur to an asparagus exporting company. His income is not enough to meet his family’s expenses, and because of this, with much effort he set up a small grocery store in his home some years ago, where he sells groceries and drinks to his customers.

Additionally, he has a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport goods and passengers) and he gets extra income from it and uses it to sustain his family.

Hermes has asked for this loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for 1000 new soles that he will use to expand his small grocery store and for the maintenance of his mototaxi since it is in need of some repairs.

He is a hardworking and responsible father. His neighbors and people he knows all hold him in high esteem. His dream is to keep growing as an entrepreneur to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic household goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years of age and married with four children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a one-room house where she stays with five people. The rest of her children stay in the village with her parents. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Florence owns a banana stall in Kisaasi. She sells bunches and clusters and doesn’t incur transport costs to and from shopping since she buys from her place of work. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over seven years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season, and the ever-increasing prices of bananas.  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over five years, servicing her tenth loan, working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, to own and to start going to the farmers directly. 
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok A. is a villager who lives in Run village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare field to cultivate rice for a living. In order to increase her income to improve her family, she is now requesting a 2,000,000 riel loan from AMK to buy a piece of rice field to increase her crops. 

Mrs. Sok A. is 55 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is a Chinese noodle seller while the other one is a grocery seller.

loans.use: To buy a piece of rice field

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Luksoon Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married with two school-aged children. Creselda runs a livestock business, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has done this for over ten years and makes approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: San Vicente (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco San Vicente lo encontramos en la parroquia Cumbe  siendo el nombre completo de esta localidad  San Luís de Cumbe está ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Este banco lo integran mujeres emprendedoras que siempre están en busca de una mejor calidad de vida y lo están consiguiendo con su trabajo diario, de lo que se sienten muy orgullosas. Esta ocasión nos acompaña el señor Eulogio Rojas Coordinador de la Regional Azuay junto a  nuestras socias.

La señora  Digna C. es una de nuestras,   vive en su casa propia apenas terminada de construir  en la comunidad  San Vicente con su esposo que trabaja en el área de la construcción  y sus tres hijos de 4,3 1 año,  ella tiene 23 años de edad y se dedica al bordado desde hace ocho años arte que  fue inculcada por su madre,  trabaja sola y en su casa compartiendo con las actividades del hogar por lo que no tiene un horario fijo y depende de los pedidos que tenga,  aparte de este negocio cría cuyes y pollos tanto para el consumo en su casa como para venderlos cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica.

Este es su quinto ciclo con el  banco comunal  y el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más cuyes y pollos para incrementar su criadero, su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.

Rosa Alejandrina P. tiene 43 años y es otra de las socias de éste banco, vive con tres de sus cinco hijos pues los dos primeros ya son casados y viven independientes,  su hijo de 18 años trabaja  en la construcción aportando con los gastos del hogar, su hija de 15 le ayuda en casa con el cuidado de los animales y solo su último hijo  estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo vive en el exterior hace once años y les ayuda económicamente y gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio lograron edificar su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal gracias a la invitación de una amiga socia de éste banco, con los créditos recibidos compró poco a poco sus  cuyes y  pollos, pero también se dedica al bordado de polleras (vestimenta tradicional) arte que aprendió sola  y por habilidad en la que lleva doce años. Con el  crédito solicitado comprará hilos, tela para confeccionar las polleras.

Tiene como meta llegar a tener un taller más grande para enseñar éste hermoso arte a más mujeres de su localidad.
texts.en:
We find the San Vicente Bank in the town of Cumbe. The full name of this locality is San Luís de Cumbe, and it is located in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca. The majority of residents are dedicated to farming and raising livestock. This bank is comprised of enterprising women who are always in search of a better standard of living. They are managing this through their daily work, which makes them very proud. On this occasion, we are accompanied by Mr. Eulogio Rojas, Regional Coordinator for Azuay, together with our other members. Digna C. is one of our own. She lives in a newly completed home in the San Vicente community, along with her husband who works in construction. They have three children, ages 4, 3 and 1. Digna is 23 years old, and has dedicated herself to embroidery for the past eight years, an art form that she learned from her mother. She works alone from her house, dividing her time between her craft and tending to the household chores. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule, as her work can vary depending on the number of orders she has. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens, both for the family’s consumption and to sell in the event they find themselves in a financial bind. This is the fifth loan cycle for this cooperative bank, and the loan requested would be used to invest in more guinea pigs and chickens as she would like to raise additional animals. Rosa Alejandrina P. is 43 years old, and another member of this bank. She lives with three of her five children, as the two oldest kids are married and living independently. Her 18-year old son works in construction, helping to support the household. Her 15-year old daughter helps her with the house and caring for the animals. Only her youngest is studying at the local school. Her husband has lived abroad for eleven years, helping them out financially. Thanks to their efforts and sacrifice, they managed to build their own home. They are in their fourth cycle with the cooperative bank, thanks to the invitation from a member. With previous loans, she bought some guinea pigs and chickens, but she also dedicates herself to embroidery of traditional garments. She learned this skill on her own, and has been doing it for twelve years. She will use the loan to buy threads and fabric with which to make her garments. Her goal is to have a larger workshop, and to be able to teach this lovely art form to more women in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens, and also thread and fabric to make traditional embroidered garments.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg L., 31, is married and the mother of two children. Her oldest daughter, Enhchimeg, is 13 years-old and attends a local primary school. Her youngest daughter is two years-old and stays at home. 

Oyunbileg operates an offal (meat) trade business with her husband at Huchit Shonhor, the biggest food market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have been operating their business since 2000, and they have great experience from the last 10 years. Oyunbileg purchases her products daily because offal is made fresh daily. With her earnings, she purchased a car for her family. In addition, with last year's profit and loan money, she was able to finish building a house with her husband's siblings help. 

Oyunbileg is a very hardworking and responsible person. She says, “I have been planning to own my own grocery store because there are not any grocery stores around here. Therefore, we expect to earn great profits from this business.”  She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to build a grocery store.

loans.use: To build a grocery store.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. N. was born in 1983. She lives in Dong Anh town. She is married with two children (a girl and a boy), who are still young. She not only grows rice but also raises pigs to scratch out a living. Her husband is a worker in Bac Thang Long industrial Park. They have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 70194.000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Zakera Zalfan Group

texts.en:
Zalfan is the group leader of Zakera Zalfan Group. She is married and she has four children who are in school.

Zalfan works hard to earn money for the support of her family’s requirements and wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She needs to buy a new sewing machine for her shop because she has lots of problems with her old one. Besides that, she wants to hire a student to support her in her business and to enlarge her business. She thanks AFS.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her shop

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 31, is married and has one daughter who is 7 years old. He is the owner of a general store where he sells sugar, cooking oil, flour, bar soap, body oil, toiletries and other general merchandise to local customers. His shop is located in a busy shopping center. He has been in this business for 11 years and his primary challenge is competition from other local shop owners. In addition to his shop, Paul also grows and sells sugar cane to generate additional income. He plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional inventory for his general store: sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour, etc.

In the future, Paul hopes to expand his business to a bigger shop so that he can better serve his customers' needs. In 5 years, he dreams of expanding and having other shops in the areas around Kisumu.

loans.use: To purchase items for his store: sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam E. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la venta de productos naturales, este negocio es una parte del ingreso familiar y que también su esposo trabaja.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no tiene la mercancía. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder compara la mercancía ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario y así mismo entregarla a tiempo a sus clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Francisco Pérez se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Miriam E. has been selling natural health products for more than a year. This business provides part of the family's income, as her husband also works. She needs more merchandise for her business, since she has various pending orders to deliver, but does not have the merchandise. She requests a loan so that she can buy merchandise since she does not have the necessary funds; in this way she can deliver her products on time to her customers. She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings she obtains from the business, since her husband, Francisco Pérez, is in charge of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky T. is from the village of Santan, Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Jinky is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jinky owns & operates a business making & selling meats for different meals and running a mini store in the local community. Jinky has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jinky is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon S., 52, is a widow farmer who lives with four of her children in Takeo province. Besides farming, she also sells fried bananas, making a combined profit of US $3 a day. Four of her children work in a garment factory. Since her children's transportation costs are so high, Nuon S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en:
Geogina A. sells grilled fish at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family.

Geogina’s loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to grill and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for a commercially-made grill.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to grill to sell

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 27 years old and married with two children who are 2 and 5 years old.  Marie Chantal owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods, mainly cosmetic goods and some other goods, as her picture indicates.  Marie Chantal has been in this business for about five years and the business hours are from 5 am to 10 pm every day.

Marie Chantal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie Chantal will purchase a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, which in turn will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers.  If successful, Marie Chantal will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.  In addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy L. is a widow with four sons and one daughter. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Channy has been a silk weaver for more than four years. She asked for a Kiva loan one time already; she now is requesting another loan of $350 to pay school fees for her sons who have not finished their studies yet.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her sons

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 29 years old and he has two children. He runs a welding business for a living.   He has three years of experience in the business and has managed to employ three people.  He also works on contract to earn extra income.  He sees himself opening another business outlet in the future.  He has requested for 30, 000 Kes to buy machines for welding.

loans.use: To buy machines for welding

loans.name: Mavis Baaba Yaa

texts.en:
Mavis Baaba Yaa A. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. She operates a beauty salon. She sometimes moves around in the locality to fix the nails of her customers. Her husband is a trader. Mavis assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is asking to use the loan to purchase products to use on her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to educate her children.

Mavis is displaying the nail polish (Cutex) she uses on her clients.

loans.use: To purchase products to use on her customers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam B., 19, lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.  Mariam has a business selling charcoal which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Mariam hopes to own a plot. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
T. Murodjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. 

In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, Murodjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Murodjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for developing business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy S., age 30, buys and sells dried fish, such as pinikas and tamban, in her local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over three years and it brings her approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Crossing Airport, Cagayan de Oro City, and have two school-aged children. 

In 2008, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
